Reviews.Title: “Happiness on the Bay!”
Reviews.Author: rpb2654
Reviews.Content: The Harbor Court Hotel is right across the street from the San Francisco Bay, and rooms on the Bay side of the property have amazing views of the San Francisco Bay Bridge, Treasure Island, and there is usually some cool Burning Man art also directly across the street along the embarcadero. Before moving back into the city, this was one of my favorite stays in San Francisco. Now, every now and then my lady and I will head down for a "stay-cation". The staff has always been friendly and courteous. Coffee in the am is perfect, and the reception in the evening is a great opportunity to sit down and enjoy the fireplace and people mingling. Grab a little dinner in one of the MANY restaurants (there are multiple options within walking distance, or grab a cab and head to "Street" on Polk). If the Giants are in town, its a reasonable walk or a short Muni ride down to the ballpark. There are a couple things about this property which are unfortunate. The inside rooms which are not overlooking the bay, well, there is no reason to open the curtain, and your experience will be better if they remain closed. Second, the $50+ per night parking has just never set right with me. Overall the rooms are tastefully done, and we have always enjoyed a good nights sleep here. There is no hesitation to go back, only fingers crossed for a bay view room :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bizarre failings”
Reviews.Author: robin k
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Habor Court hotel for three nights in February. Great location but the hotel has some strange deficiencies. Our room on the third floor overlooked the airconditioning system and another building instead of San Francisco Bay one street away. The hotel has no restaurant and offers only coffee and tea in the morning - you have to go out and scavange the surrounding streets for a bagel and at the weekends little is open. Gym facilities are offered next door at the YMCA which has a (usually empty) restaurant - so why not allow Harbor Court guests access to this facility too? Still, this hotel is well run, has a good front desk and good value. But with minimum extra effort and cost (eg buying in croissants each morning) it could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is perfect, except the exceptionally loud air duct outside the window....”
Reviews.Author: flaggster
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely perfect, until I tried to go to sleep. The staff are wonderful, the location is excellent, the rooms are cozy but nicely decorated. But avoid the rooms on the 03 and 05 series! The noise is a rumbling vibration that is really unbearable. I asked to move from an 05 room and was given an 03 room! Oh well, they tried. I might stay here again but I would pay extra for an outside facing room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Hotel in Exciting Area”
Reviews.Author: FlySwim
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. The location is really great. It is on a relatively quiet block (Steuart St; there is a 2nd entrance on Embarcadero) very close to the Ferry Building and the Financial District. The staff is very helpful, and there are many restaurants on the block. The rooms are incredibly small, but very comfortable. Overall, I highly recommend the Harbor Court. The rooms may make you feel claustrophobic, it is true. We had a Bay View king room, so the bed was big, the light was good and the panorama of the Bay Bridge and beyond was fantastic. (I saw that interior rooms were dark, but they looked fine if you don't care about the view. Queen rooms were even smaller.) The furniture and bathrooms were quite comfortable. Very nice bathroom products. I didn't mind being in the small room because it was all so nice. The hotel employees were quite friendly and helpful with advice. The cleaning staff was warm and worked efficiently. The YMCA next door is a nice gym option; my hotel rate included gym use, but you may have to pay. The lobby is very cozy, with a warm fireplace and wi-fi service. I truly enjoyed coming back each day to the hotel, and just hanging out in the lobby. I was on a work trip, and I was able to do work there as did several others most of the day. There is water all day, a.m. coffee, a wine happy hour, and cookies at night. The neighborhood is really coming up and cool. You can quickly walk to Market St. There are nearby Starbucks, Walgreens, and restaurants catering to workers in the area. The restaurants on the block are a bit expensive but good. Perry's for breakfast (the only real option) is not too pricey, and the food was much better than expected (it looks like an old bar from the outside). Ozu is a solid and fun sushi spot (if evidently not really Japanese). I would certainly return to this hotel. The usual Kimpton pluses were on display. If you are on business or get a good deal (perhaps on weekends -- the place is quite expensive during the week), the Harbor Court is a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Valerie S
Reviews.Content: the nicest thing that I can say about this hotel is that it is located next to a great restraunt, Perrys. The service at the front desk was so rude to us when we checked in this hotel made me happy that we were only staying one night. I do like though how they have Aveda in the room though.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Downtown Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NormK413
Reviews.Content: If you are a road warrior you will love this hotel. It is a complete departure from the ordinary to the luxurious. Perfect location, a wonderful staff, and an incredible Japanese Restaurant downstairs. DO NOT miss the 9pm cookies and milk!! I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: Lune14
Reviews.Content: I spent the long weekend here and glad I chose it over one of those large impersonal chain hotels. I was glad to be cheered upon arrival as if coming back after a (very long indeed) flight. As some others have noted, this may not be as luxurious as other Kimpton properties, and the decor (especially in the hallways) do appear a bit dated. But it delivers on all Kimpton qualities: friendly and helpful service, fast check in/out, exceptionally clean rooms and facilities, and of course the free coffee in the morning and wine in the evening. Regardless if you use these extras, it is just great to have a warm and cozy lobby to mingle with fellow guests. The room itself was larger than I expected (it is narrow, but you have plenty of room at the foot of the bed), the bed extremely comfy, and you get free wi-fi on the loyalty program. And the Bay view rooms are really worth the extras, you could lie in bed and admire the lights at night. Priceless (trust me, I have paid way more for other views in SF!). One of the key reasons I chose to be here was location. It's easily accessible to public transportation, including the BART to SFO 3 blocks down (for the sake of clarity, the Griffon and Vitale are within a block too). It's literally 2 blocks from the Ferry Plaza, which has plenty of dining options for breakfast and lunch, and the best wine bar in town. However you will want to go to North Beach or Marina for a wider array of choices, as during the night this area is a bit dead. I loved the Harbor Court and this will definitely be on top of my list when back to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay and close to bay bridge”
Reviews.Author: wte154
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located with impeccable service. The room was clean, although a bit small. I enjoyed my stay and I will be back. Many good restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great place on Embarcadero”
Reviews.Author: Zael
Reviews.Content: I spent a night in this hotel and was very happy with it, the service is very professional, the rooms are nice and clean, wifi is for free if you become a member of the club, fireplace in the lobby is cozy, the room had a very modern feel to it with a great view of the Bay Bridge. We got a promotion, so they greeted us with a free champagne in the room. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not on par with the Kimpton brand”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoTraveler925
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Harbor Court for one night during a business trip to SF. The location of the hotel is great... across the street from the Ferry Building with a really nice view of the bay bridge and walking distance to a BART station. The staff was friendly enough and checked me into my room early with no problems. The one thing I noticed almost immediately was that the hotel lobby area seemed a little run-down and stuffy. The room itself was very small (which is OK for a SF hotel) but also stuffy. It was clean for the most part but again seemed pretty run-down. There was an attempt to give it a little bit of the Kimpton style but it definitely fell short - and didn't seem at all to be the caliber of other Kimpton hotels around the country.

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely Return”
Reviews.Author: wombatboy
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay. The staff were very friendly, the room was just what we needed--nothing huge, and maybe small for some, but this is why I stay in the boutique hotels. I don't need a big box room. Everything was clean and well thought out. Location was great--easy to walk down to the wharf and also over to the F Line Street Car. Also near some convince stores, Starbucks, etc. I continue to be happy with my stays at the Kimpton properties. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great staff”
Reviews.Author: ChickyLu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently with a voucher and upgraded to a king room with a view. What a view! Room was nice, comfortable, good TV and had lovely windows facing the Bay Bridge. And the windows open. Asked the housekeeping staff for an extra chair; one was brought promptly. Wine hour is just that. Don't come 61 minutes after it starts. Dog friendly and lots of cute, well-behaved dogs in the spacious lobby. Nice area for sitting, with a fire place and a TV, as well as several places to plug in one's laptop. Good location. Good value with a voucher.

Reviews.Title: “A+ Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: danielsonkin
Reviews.Content: Kimpton is a great boutique hotel company, and the Harbor Point didn't disappoint. We stayed there over New Year's weekend and it was a delight. To see the Treasure Island fireworks, we literally just had to step outside the door. What we love about Kimpton Hotels is their dog-friendly properties. We even brought our goldfish with us because we didn't have a fish-sitter that weekend. They provide nightly wine and hot chocolate in the lobby and freshly baked cookies. The rooms have nice touches such as bathrobes and ipod compatible speakers. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “my view of concrete wall”
Reviews.Author: grady97
Reviews.Content: the good news is my room is very quiet. the bad news is that i face a wall about 5 feet away from my window and the wall goes up another 1-2 stories, so give up if you are in the 4th or 5th floor. room is clean and very small. no coffee maker in room and only cold breakfast. ymca is suppose to be great but i have not tried it yet and i am sure it will be crowded.

Reviews.Title: “I want to like it, but the rooms are just too small”
Reviews.Author: pme57
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Harbor Court several times. I really enjoy the youthful, but relaxing, chic vibe that Kimpton puts into their hotels. The wine reception in the evening is very nice. The relaxing lobby with a fireplace, plenty of conversation areas, and WiFi is a nice place to unwind after work and catch up on your notebook or tablet. And at 9:00pm, they put out warm cookies and milk. The staff is very nice. On my recent stay, one of them went out of her way to help me find my missing Kimpton loyalty number and get it recorded. And the loyalty program gives you a discount on the well stocked in-room mini-bar and snacks. The rooms are nicely decorated and include all of the needed amenities. So what's wrong with this picture? The rooms are just too small for a business traveler. They're small to begin with, and then there is just too much furniture. No place to put your bag. Hard to get your clothes in and out of the armoire. The TV is in your face above the desk. Just no way to get comfortable. If you're a tourist who just needs a convenient downtown place to crash late every night, this is the place. (Though I wouldn't pay these prices for a fun tourist visit.) But as a business traveler staying and working, it's just too cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Chip D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here many times, always a great experience. The whole staff is always very friendly and helpful. While most rooms are "a bit cosy," everything I need is there. The location is awesome. You are very close to Union Square shopping and restaurants and transit to the rest of San Fran is less than three blocks away. I know I'll be back. The Harbor Court has truly become a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location with a great view”
Reviews.Author: Spiderquadrifoglio
Reviews.Content: The Kimpton chain always offers a great value and some fun decor. My room was immaculately clean. The room was a little on the small side, but not a problem and it had all the ammenities (including thick furry leopard print robes - yikes!! Helloooo Mr. Hefner :-) The bed was extremely comfortable and if you request a bay view room, you will be treated to a gorgeous view of the water and the Bay Bridge. I was on the 4th floor facing the bay and could not hear any noise from the street below. They have a wine reception each evening. The staff was very efficient and friendly. I had stayed at another hotel in this area a few years ago and I really like the location. There are many excellent restaurants on the surrounding blocks, the Ferry Terminal building is just a block away and it has many food shops and restaurants. It is a bit of a walk to get to Fisherman's Wharf (perhaps a mile?), but it is a very picturesque and flat stroll. You can also walk about a mile in the other direction and get to the baseball stadium and the bars and restaurants that are in that neighborhood. The waterfront also makes a great spot for runners. Be prepared for the $42 per night parking fee - but that is fairly typical of hotels in large cities. I would definitely stay at the Harbor Court the next time I am in San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Great clean room would defintly stay here again”
Reviews.Author: raquelcg7
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was very friendly . Hotel was beautiful great location . Room was clean and comfy . I had a great view of the bay. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: Scout9857
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay here 1/13-1/18 2012...a cozy yet chic hotel surrounded by amazing restaurants, especially the hotel's Japanese gem Ozumo... Ate at Boulevard, One Market, Yank Sing(dim sum wonderland), Town Hall, Americano, Epic Roast House, too- they are all steps from the hotel and each one thrilled us. Also, the Ferry landing is right out the door and that place is rocking with food stalls, coffee spots, book store, and a Saturday farmer's market that is not to be missed.I would stay here again in a heartbeat, and next time I'll bring my pugs to this pet-friendly place.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the price”
Reviews.Author: AZ_Reviews02
Reviews.Content: As a pet owner whose dog travels everywhere, I am a big fan of Kimpton hotels. While Kimpton has several hotels in San Francisco, I chose this location as I thought it was right across from a park area, and a little less crowded. However knowing what I know now for going out, or getting a cab, or eating anywhere nearby, I would definitely choose one of their Union Square locations over this one. Pros/Cons from my stay.. PROS - Great view of the bay bridge (if you book a bay view room) - Friendly staff - Near a BART stop if you're coming from SFO CONS - No restaurants nearby - Teeny, tiny rooms - Occupy Wall Street is about two blocks from here - Area is completely shut down in evenings Overall, this doesn't change my perception of Kimpton, just would choose a different hotel in another neighborhood for the future. If you're a business traveler attending meetings in the financial district and taking the BART from SFO, then this might be more ideal.

Reviews.Title: “traveled with our dog and loved this SF hotel”
Reviews.Author: chubs001
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel AND a great value for your money. We chose to stay at a Kimpton hotel because we had a 18 lb dog with us and their hotels don't add an extra charge. Awesomeness. Why can't it always be that simple? We got a free upgrade to a bay front view which meant a perfectly unobstructed view of the bay bridge and the ferry building. Location is great if you want to check out the farmer's market over the weekend, which is directly across the street. Yes, the rooms are small, but what SF hotel isn't? They have complimentary coffee and hot chocolate in the morning, and my regret is not arriving earlier for the complimentary happy hour. Tip: Parking is $40, but we got around this because the area is deserted at night since it's in the financial district. We just parked for free in the metered area right across the street and took off at 7 am when they start enforcing the meters. This was so worth it for us since we were roadtripping anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a visit to San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Kathy O
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights here recently and could not have asked for a better experience. The rooms are not large, but very well maintained and appointed. The staff is consistently pleasant, helpful and accomodating and all the little extras, like the morning newspaper delivered to your door, the wine social hour and bedtime cookies make this a very warm and comfortable place to stay. Outside the hotel, great restaurants are abundant, the ferry building is close by and all forms of transportation are very easily accessible. I love San Francisco and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else when I'm visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: YaKa1355
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night on New years eve. We couldn't ask for a better location. The hotel is a couple of blocks from the Ferry Building and all we had to do was to walk out around 12:00 am to watch the fireworks right across the street. We booked our room through Hotwire. It was small, but very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The basics (shampoo, conditioner, lotion, hair dryer and iron) are in the room and for a fee you can get other items you may have forgotten like hair straighter or curler. We did not have bay view room but it didn't matter to us as we were planning on going out. There are lots of good restaurants in the walking distance. The staff are friendly and eager to help. There is a $40 charge for valet parking. Overall, it's a great hotel in a great location and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: IsaandJm
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel, the first stay was a gift for my birthday and we enjoyed our stay so when we needed to book another hotel we decided to choose the Harbor Court hotel again. First and foremost, location is really great, across from the Ferry Building and all those yummy places to eat or buy great food (don't miss Recchiuti chocolates) and the statue of Ghandi in the back of the building, worth checking it out. The lobby is very enjoyable, they have a fire going on, some chairs and couch to sit in and enjoy wine in the evening. Rooms, at least the two we have been in, are not big, but their size was fine to us as we were going out to enjoy the city. We have stayed both times in a bay view room with a king bed, so I can't say anything about the other rooms, maybe the standard ones are not as enjoyable as the ones with the view on the bay bridge and the bay. The Harbor Court hotel is a lovely, simple but good little boutique hotel, and we have received good to great service there. During our most recent stay, I mentionned to the person who helped me at front desk that I was hoping to have a room with a tub to enjoy a nice bath. Her name was Tawny, and she brought me, along with the free bottle of sparkling wine that came with our rate, a candle, some bath salts and a nice big bath sponge. That is customer service in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Will Return”
Reviews.Author: Merle D
Reviews.Content: First off, we paid for a standard king room. When we checked in and got to the room, I realized that the room came with a lovely view of the hotel's air conditioning unit. I went downstairs and spoke with someone at the desk. We were immediately upgraded to a room with a view of the San Francisco Bay and the Bay Bridge at no charge! The hotel was immaculately kept. The room was clean and bathroom was spotless. The bed best was one of the most comfortable hotel beds that I've ever slept in. There's also a free wine and beer reception in the lobby every night from 5-6. Oh, and this hotel does offer free wifi if you join the Kimptom club or something like that. This definitely was a pleasant stay. The only problem was the fact that it didn't last long enough. I would most definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: brysully
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Harbor Court as I was in town for one night for business. My business was at 4 Embarcadero which we a convenient 10 minute walk. While in town for the night we had dinner at the Tadich Grill (excellent) and saw a Christmas Concert at the SF Symphony (10 minute cab ride)....the hotel is conveniently located on the harbor and a quick walk to the Ferry Building and the financial district. My wife and I are walkers so for us the hotel was in walking distance to everything we would normally do in the City. The hotel was clean, the staff was excellent and the rooms very nice, all at a very good rate for a quality big city hotel. There is a Japanese restaurant next door which looked great (my wife is Japanese so we do the Japanese thing frequently) but we did not have time to partake on this trip. We are definitely staying at the Harbor Court on our next trip and will make a point of dining at the Japanese restaurant. Highly recommend this hotel for a stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Mazalati
Reviews.Content: We went to San Francisco is August 2011 for my birthday and stayed at this hotel. It is a very nice hotel with wonderful service and really charming touches like serving complimentary wine and beer in the early evening in a pretty room with a fireplace and a view of the bay. The rooms are very nice and clean and the hotel staff is very helpful and professional. The hotel is right on the Embarcadero which is where all the action is (don't let the address fool you, there are two entrances to the hotel). When you step outside the hotel you can see the bay and the bay bridge. There is a great place for pictures or romantic walks at night right across the street. You can walk just a short distance from the hotel and be at many different wonderful restaurants (also the hotel restaurant is very good too). It is a very short walk to catch public transportation to all the major sites in San Francisco or you can easily walk. It is also a short walk to the Ferry terminal that has been turned into a lovely shopping center with many unique shops and restaurants. On the weekend this same terminal has an Amazing public market with all kinds of fresh fruits, veggies, baked goods and also arts and crafts. I can't wait to go back to San Francisco and I plan on always staying at this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with tremendous view”
Reviews.Author: msfrazer
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in great location. Rooms are a touch small but it was fine for us. Careful about valet parking as it's expensive. Plenty of parking in the area...they serve wine every night for happy hour...staff was helpful..

Reviews.Title: “Surprise Civically Minded Staff!”
Reviews.Author: DoctorBuckles
Reviews.Content: I have stayed over a couple times mid-week for work, but in my last visit I discovered when I actually read the employeeâ€™s badges â€“ that the Harbor Court had civic-mindedness happening! Everyone has a favorite city thing they either do for fun or volunteer at. It is part of the hotelâ€™s â€œcommunityâ€� feel for guests. If you want to know how the locals live and what they do, this is the place for you. Everyone is very helpful and very friendly. The location is great if youâ€™re a tourist or love walking along the Bay. The hotel also provides running maps of the city, and you get complimentary access to the YMCA that is actually part of the building. Cocktail hour has non-alcoholic warmed spiced cider if you donâ€™t drink, and hot chocolate in the morning with coffee. Very good! I had a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy B
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at the Harbor Court Hotel in San Francisco was a result of winning a 2-night stay through a donation at a charitable event. Kimpton is a generous charitable company. In any case, we loved the experience so much that we extended several nights, and have since returned to this hotel every time we come to San Francisco. It is located in a GREAT place - right across from the San Francisco Farmers Market, and next door to a fantastic gym at the YMCA. Around the corner there is a string of fantastic restaurants. AMAZING! Our room has been clean and comfortable every time, and the people at the Harbor Court go out of their way to make things perfect for guests!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but too Many Pets”
Reviews.Author: SactoDan
Reviews.Content: Wev'e stayed here several times and thoroughly enjoy the location, room, and staff but unfortunatly we saw Kimpton's "Pet Friendly" policy too much this past weekend with lots of large dogs staying in the hotel. Since they allow pets I inquired at the desk about the policy and how many rooms or floors they dedicate to pets. To my surprise, out of the five floors, only one was for people only and the other four for pets. That's 80% of the rooms that had/have pets in them . I don't mind pets but not knowing the people who own them I'm not one to want to stay in rooms that have had dogs sleeping on the beds and whatever else they may do in the room at night. So, if you don't mind this hotel being a possible kennel during your stay go for it; as mentioned earlier, this is a great place, but...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sarah v
Reviews.Content: stayed here for work, the staff are so friendly and informitive. only 30 min walk to peir 39 and10 mins to the hub of the city were there is food. The Japanese restaurant was yummy (but book in advance) it was super busy every night. there is a few close restaurants as well which were nice. Only 10 min walk to the ferry building with all the nice shops. I liked how the hotel was pet friendly was nice to see they care for animals. and the free wine at 5 pm was very tempting. very much loved staying at the Harbor Court hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Meaningful Memories, Special Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaryAdvisor2011
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be near the Golden Gate Bridge, close to the water, and accessible to the BART to enjoy a quiet visit to San Francisco so we opted for the Harbor Court by the Embarcadero while our other family members and friends stayed in the Union Square area. Our location was perfect. From the moment we arrived to the instant we left, the staff were exceptional in helping us with any request (the hop on hop off tour bus stops in front of the hotel). The water front is just steps away, and the views are breath taking. During our first morning, we walked to the Ferry building, through the financial district, and on to the piers and cable car stops. Early during the second morning, we waved to two guests as they left for a 10 mile hike on the marked jogging trail. As we boarded a boat and sailed under the Golden Gate Bridge, I was happy to have stayed near the spot that my father, a W.W. II Marine vet, loved. On day three, when meeting our other family and friends, we commented on our great stay at the Harbor Court, the awesome location, and only noted that the rooms were smaller than we expected.We then learned the story of the Harbor Court and its role in housing the WW II soldiers before they left for duty. Who knew? Perhaps I had stayed near the room where my father was just before he shipped out! With that bit of history, the smaller rooms seem giant in size, as the Harbor Court is mighty in history and meaning. I stay in many different hotels that I never remember, but I will always remember with warmth and affection Harbor Court, meaningful memories, in a special and historical boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ParisPeaprincess
Reviews.Content: Ask for an ocean view, it is really worth it. Bay Bridge at sunrise and sunset makes for great photos. The room was smallish but big enough for the 2 of us and our suitcases. The bed was very comfortable. The people at the desk very helpful. The Japanese restaurant next door is excellent. Very convenient for the ferry building. We walked to Union Square easily. We would return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location, room location makes a difference”
Reviews.Author: murphykds
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay somewhere other than Union Square this trip so booked the Harbor Court down by the Embarcadero. The location is fabulous. Right across from the ferry building with all its shops, restaurants, and Saturday farmers market. Three blocks from Bart and the street cars take you everywhere--ATT Park (just a 15 minute walk); Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square. The lobby area is very nice--lots of comfortable seating areas, a fireplace, etc. and there is great morning coffee service, evening wine service, and evening milk and cookies. You have access to the YMCA fitness center next door which is nicer than any Y I've ever seen. There is no restaurant in the hotel but lots of options within a block including the ferry building. The service was outstanding from the desk clerks to housekeeping staff. Yes, the rooms aren't huge but I've been in a lot smaller and a lot less nice. The space planning is amazing with drawers under the bed, etc. Very comfortable bed, great toiletries and high quality linens. The one downside, and its a downside, is that many of the outside rooms look over a huge HVAC unit. I was on an upper floor so the noise was just a constant hum that I could "absorb" but for someone sensitive to noise it would be a problem. The Bay view rooms and the inside facing rooms do not have the problem. I tried to upgrade to a Bay view room but they were sold out and I didn't want the darkness of an inside facing room. I would definitely stay here again. Service means everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, front desk not up to usual Kimpton level”
Reviews.Author: DrFritz
Reviews.Content: The room was great and just what I expected - clean and with a great view. The front desk provided less that usual Kimpton service. No one on the door, had to ask about valet parking, a seemingly disinterested desk person - poor social skills - not what I've come to expect at Kimpton.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice SF hotel”
Reviews.Author: mos6636
Reviews.Content: A nice, quiet, elegant hotel that we stayed at for a getaway trip to SF. Located close to the F line streetcar and is a stop on the Open Top Sightseeing bus route. We chose a bay view room and had a great view of the Bay Bridge. The wine reception in the evening is a plus. There are a few good restaurants within walking distance, and the Ferry Building is right across the Embarcadero. It is across the city from most of the tourist locations, which suited us fine, allowing us to escape the crowds. I highly recommmend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mbrasil
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Harbor Court and found it to be a very nice place to stay. The staff was friendly and the furnishing/decor were very stylish. The location worked out well for us. We stayed in their queen suite which has nice views of the Bay Bridge and floor to ceiling windows that let plenty of light in. Overall, the size of the room for a suite was small, but that is expected in the smaller boutique hotels in San Francisco. Everything was very clean and comforting. They even put out milk and cookies in the evening. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Think European not Small”
Reviews.Author: VanCanucksFan
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights and read the reviews...most reviews say the hotel rooms are "too small" which for me meant you had a small area to walk at the end of the bed, but really...how much room do you need for a hotel room if you are there to explore the city and have fun. Was 2 blocks away from the Bay Bridge, near the Bart Station. Hotel room included internet, free wine social in the evenings, and morning coffee and muffin

Reviews.Title: “A place to celebrate Anniversaries!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gabriel D
Reviews.Content: By luck we wound up celebrating our 39th Wedding Anniversary at the Harbor Court. From check-in to check-out (a whole week!!) they made us feel welcome and very special. The first greeting was a bottle of wine with a welcome note. From then on, the whole staff helped us plan each day of our stay. A beautiful trip to Napa Valley with a hotel-related driver took us to many wineries; truly a great experience. They are really locals and know how to poitn the way to enjoyment!! A small hotel experience is very different from a large hotel stay were no one knows who you are!! Don't miss out on the great restaurant next door!! Great food and ambiance. Very close to city transportation, piers and everything one could think of!! A week was so short!!

Reviews.Title: “So Very San Fran!”
Reviews.Author: Butchsrs
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small boutique hotel that is right on the Waterfront and staffed by a group that knows how to make you feel at home. Great location, wonderful Kimpton feel, and how can you beat pet friendly with cookies and milk at night!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: flextravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and enjoyed the service and our room. The staff at the front desk and the housekeeping crew were very friendly and helpful. Our room was excellent and not as small as expected. It overlooked the Bay Bridge and Embarcadero and the area was very and surprisingly quite even on a Saturday evening. Close to AT&T Park, where we took in a Cal football game and many restaurants and bars and far enough from Market Street, the location was just right for us. We parked using the valet service and it worked very well although it was a bit pricey; however, we were willing to hunt for street spaces late in the evenings. Cab service to this area seemed to be nonexistent so our options were limited. We plan to return in a few months and look forward to another excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “"Friendly and helpful staff"”
Reviews.Author: Carol D
Reviews.Content: We try to go to Harbor Court every 4 months or so. There are so many things we love about it. The location is close to our favorite restaurants, the ferry building, public transportation and is on the beautiful SF Bay. The evening wine hour is in a beautiful great room off the lobby and is very nice. In the morning tea and coffee are available there. There is a large selection of complimentary newspapers in the lobby to choose from. The rooms are a bit small but well done to make up for it. The staff is very friendly and goes out of their way to help. We always enjoy our stay. Carol D

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: J M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. They go way out of their way to make sure you are treated well. The rooms are a little small, but the location makes up for it completely. We missed the complimentary wine event, so they sent a bottle of wine to our room for free. The best experience I've had at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KF505
Reviews.Content: My parents stayed here on a trip to San Francisco and referred me when I was out in the area for business. I was incredibly impressed with the hotel. The staff was amazingly friendly and put me in a room with an incredibly view of the bay and the bay bridge. The location of this hotel cannot be beat both as a tourist and a business traveler. It is across the street from the Ferry Building with lots of shops, restaurants, and views, including the ferry terminals. There are other restaurants nearby too. The YMCA is next door to workout or you can run along the water (also across the street). For business, it is walking distance to most places in the financial district. If you are driving, the location offers probably the easiest entrance/exit to outlying areas that I've had in the city. I will continue to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: Scott B
Reviews.Content: Great location right on the Embarcadero with all the Kimpton amenities like the wine happy hour in a beautiful lobby before you step out on the Embarcadero to the tremendous dinner options in the neighborhood, plus if you're nice to the front desk you may end up with one of the rooms with a great view of the Bay Bridge to end the evening in style. Fav in SF and I'm there alot!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the city”
Reviews.Author: ROXY6997
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Harbor Court about 5 times in the last year. We often head to SF for leisure and this is usually our choice hotel. They have reasonable rates, an awesome location, and great service. We have never had a bad experience and the rooms are always immaculate. Fair warning though, the rooms are not huge, but unless you are traveling to sit and enjoy the interior of your hotel room, they are perfectly spacious enough. AND parking is pricey, but expensive parking is a fact of life in SF...no getting around it. Harbor Court is a great home base to walk everywhere, even more so if you enjoy long walks with great scenery...close to BART also, for those who don't enjoy walking. I have stayed in several hotels (including the very low and high end ones) throughout the city and believe me there are many hotels that are super expensive and well worth the money, but there are also too many that are decievingly mid-range priced as a nice place only to find out it's run down or just disgusting. If you want cleanliness, value, and great service without an unbelieveable price tag, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: JiRobi
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Harbor Court at least 3 times in the last year or so, and have never had a bad experience. While the rooms (and bathrooms) are small, the beds are very comfortable, the building is quiet, and the staff is helpful and friendly. Best of all, the location is great. It is convenient to many bus lines, BART, cable cars, the Ferry Building with its farmers market, and the financial district. Most of the time, the rates at the Harbor Court (at least on weekends) are as good or better than any comparable place.

Reviews.Title: “My visit was too short!”
Reviews.Author: BearFromLA
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write this review for sometime and had a meeting cancelation so this gets it off my to do list. I had business in SF on sudden notice. Working for a NFP cost is always a factor and a friend recommended the Harbor Court. It was close to the meeting location and more affordable than the large hotels in the area. What a surprise! The Harbor Court is now my favorite venue in SF. The staff was delightful and went the extra mile to be helpful; they hold a wine reception in the afternoon before you go out to the great restaurants next door. The rooms are small but in fairness, the place was built in the â€˜20s. Location cannot be matched, right on the Embarcadero across from the ferry building. My only regret was my trip was too short, I will be back for pleasure many times to come.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda E
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. The location is right on the water, close to downtown, restaurants and shopping. The service was friendly and professional. There is a complimentary wine hour each night. If you can, book a room with a Bay view!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but clean rooms in central location.”
Reviews.Author: KyleyR
Reviews.Content: Arrived to friendly service, unfortunately rooms not available before 3pm. A little tough on people arriving on long haul flights so keep in mind. The rooms are tiny but newly refurbished and kept very clean. Water pressure at times a little weak, but generally fine. Hair dryers supplied are the type that singe rather than dry hair, so bring your own or buy a cheapy (if yours won't work properly on US power supply) from the Walgreens a block away as I did. Unless you enjoy looking over air-conditioning ducts, ensure you book the more expensive bay view room type. The staff are very friendly and helpful. If they don't have an answer, they look it up on the PC whilst you wait. The location is fairly nice - a few minutes walk from Embarcadero BART so you can get there very easily and cheaply from the airport. Being at the far end of the financial district means it is nice and quiet with little or no street sounds. Plenty of cafes and restaurants about as well. It's about a 20 min walk to Union Square or walk 2 mins to Market and jump on a tram (cable car). All in all, a nice, quiet, clean place to stay. I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location and Comfortable Accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: mops1234
Reviews.Content: We live in the Bay Area and decided to have a short weekend trip to San Francisco. We chose the Harbor Court not only through reviews from Trip Advisor travelers, but also the bonus "free parking" that Trip Advisor had going on at that time. We booked our room and then upgraded to the King bed with Bay Bridge view. We were not disappointed. As other travelers have mentioned, the rooms are more on the small side, but efficient. The view of the bridge was beautiful! A couple times in the night I woke up, sat up in bed and saw the glowing lights of the bridge right outside the window. The Happy Hour was very fun and we enjoyed a nice glass of wine after running around all day. The location was wonderful...away from the hub-bub of Fisherman's Wharf, but right across the street from the Ferry Building, walking paths and numerous excellent restaurants. The staff was excellent! The staff was more than willing to assist with questions and they all seemed very happy about being with Harbor Court. I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Getaway”
Reviews.Author: marintamrunner
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Harbor Court in San Francisco to celebrate her birthday. We live in Marin County so we took the ferry over and walked to the hotel. The location of the hotel is perfect. It is along the Embarcadero where there is so much to do, but off the main drag and far enough away from all the crazy touristy stuff. ( Although if that is something you want to do, you could easily take a street car or walk!) The staff was incredibley friendly and helpful. Their nametags also include their area of expertise, such as book stores or coffee houses. The rooms are small but well designed for their size, and very clean. They have everything you need and will get you whatever you forgot. We were on the 7th floor without a view but it felt so private and was nice and quiet. I did not hear anyone else on our floor nor was I bothered by street noise. Also important to note is the beds are super-comfy. We took advantage of the lounge area, which is as inviting as a living room and we REALLY appreciated the use of the YMCA! It is a phenomenal gym, complete with a pool, basketball court and lots of classes and equipment. We loved our stay at the Harbor Court and look forward to coming back...with our dog!

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious, poor quality, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: PF2UK
Reviews.Content: They promise a lot on their website. They don't deliver. The rooms are small and some are downright depressing - showing their age. Some of the reception staff are spiteful - we asked for a quiet room having read comments on Tripadvisor about the air conditioning plant outside some rooms - we were given a room with the machinery immediately outside. We asked to be moved and the staff were quite rude and, I think intentionally, moved us to an even smaller room which still had air conditioning equipment outside but was also next to the ice machine. It took several difficult phone calls before the shift manager (who deserve a lot of credit) moved us to a better room. But despite all the 'free wine' and 'milk and cookies' and Aveda toiletries - it's poky, a bit shabby, and with mostly very poor customer service. And not short on attitude...largely bad.

Reviews.Title: “Little Touches”
Reviews.Author: Jernhon
Reviews.Content: Though the rooms are a tad small, we love this hotel for the overall vibe and extra touches like cookies & milk in the evening, Aveda products in the bathroom, the beautiful & spacious gathering space for morning coffee and evening wine. The staff here make us feel extra welcome, the Ferry Building and its markets are across the street, and the absolute best part is walking along the waterfront to & from the ballpark!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Harbour Court - Just too short!”
Reviews.Author: Goviegovie
Reviews.Content: Being our first time visiting California, myself and the girlfriend were delighted to recieve the standard and quality that the Harbour Court offered to us for the 3 nights we stayed. Although the room was a little smaller than we had anticipated, it still had all everything you could want, Robes, Iron + Board, Umbrella and I-Pod Docking station **Not suitable for UK I-Pod**. At check in, David on the front desk even organised some Champagne to be sent to the room on the house just to help us relax after a long jouney. very appreciated! The location of the hotel is perfect too. 10 mins walking from Union Square, 10 mins walk from Fishermans Wharf with spectacular views over the Oakland Bridge. Also dont forget to give the Ozumo restaurant next door a visit. In particular try the Soft Shell Crab!!! Overall, thoroughly recommend this hotel, especially for the coffee in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hayron
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a great location. Free fresh baked warm cookies and milk every night! Coffee, tea, and hot chocolate in the morning. Close to local fresh food market on Saturday's. Short walk to pier 39 and rail cars. I would definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: travelbug61
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in Union Square when I visit SF, but as a birthday treat for myself, I decided to book a bay view room at the Harbor Court. My room more than lived up to expectations--the views of the Bay and Bay Bridge were awesome, both day and night, and the room itself was extremely clean, comfortable and peaceful. It was so well laid out that, despite its compact size, it felt cozy in the best sense, and not at all cramped. The weather turned hot part-way through my stay, and the room's well-functioning A/C was much appreciated. The free wi-fi was really fast and reliable. The lobby was an attractive and inviting place to hang out in; the citrus-infused water available all day, and the coffee/tea available in the morning, were nice touches. I loved the Embarcadero location, just a block from the Ferry Building and near many top-notch restaurants--an area perfect for foodies, and with none of the tackiness so prevalent in Union Square and Fisherman's Wharf. It was great strolling over to the Ferry Building for breakfast every morning, and for the farmers markets 3 days of the week. The hotel is convenient to lots of useful bus lines, the F-streetcar, and the Embarcadero BART/Muni stations. Taking BART to and from the airport is really easy. The housekeeping staff did a phenomenal job keeping the hotel in tip-top shape and making me feel welcome. Marina, who is in charge of housekeeping, introduced herself to me as I was checking into my room, and encouraged me to contact her if I needed anything for my room. However, my room was always kept in such perfect condition that I never had any issues to report at all. And, every time I came across a member of the housekeeping dept. during my stay, I was met with a smile and a warm greeting. The bell staff was also great--really efficient in storing and retrieving luggage, and a few times when I was waiting by the front entrance for a friend to come pick me up, the bell staff always approached me promptly and courteously if I needed help with transportation or anything else. Sadly, the only thing that kept my experience at this hotel from being perfect was the front-desk staff. Most of them seemed young and somewhat unpolished, and I can't recall any that seemed particularly helpful, efficient or welcoming. Check-in was esp. frustrating, as I arrived when there was only one young man working behind the desk. He spent a lot of time helping the couple in front of me with a bunch of non-hotel-related issues, during which time my presence was never once acknowledged. Really, is it so much trouble to say "I'll be with you in a moment" or to call a colleague to come back you up at the front desk?! When my turn finally came, I received no greeting, no welcome; just a brusque "Can I help you?" Talk about an abysmal introduction to the hotel, and being made to feel like a third-class citizen! During check-in, he also failed to volunteer any information about the hotel's amenities, but only answered direct questions that I put to him. Fortunately, most of the front-desk staff seemed somewhat friendlier and more engaged in their jobs, and in any case, I didn't need to interact much with them for the rest of my stay, as I'm a frequent visitor to SF and didn't need help planning my activities or getting around town. Overall, I would give the front-desk staff a rating of 2.5 stars (the check-in guy gets zero stars!), while the housekeeping and bell staffs both merit 5 stars. These hiccups with sub-par front-desk service wouldn't prevent me from staying at this beautiful, well-located hotel again. I loved my cozy, clean bayview room with its magnificent views, and would book one again in a heartbeat, esp. if I can get another good discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly + efficient + good location”
Reviews.Author: OnurWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Ups: 1. Location: Quick walk to (i) the marketplace building (about 3-4 minutes) with great food selection and (ii) pier 33 for alcatraz boats (about 15 minutes). Walking distance about 20 minutes, or a quick tram ride (5 minutes) to union square. The hop-on, hop-off bus we booked also had a stop right in front of the hotel, so it worked out perfectly for us. 2. Friendliness: Staff was great and very knowledgable. We were celebrating mom's milestone b-day and they gave us a bay-view upgrade, though only for one of the two nights we stayed there. We needed a couple of things printed and they did it with no fuss. 3. Amenities: Nice details - flavored water in the lobby during the day, cookies and milk at night and coffee/tea in the morning (until noon). Downs: There's only one, which is the size of the rooms, but it is SF afterall, and you know the drill... Two major suggestions: Check out the oyster restaurant at the marketplace for seafood and cowgirl creamery for a low-key/cheese oriented lunch. We will definitely be back at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: captron197
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Florida and attempted to check in at 11am. Nick t the counter informed us that our room was not ready. He suggested a place for lunch, took our bags and told us our room would be ready when we returned. It was. The room is very small but the view of the bay was amazing and the room was really clean. The hotel is in a great location and offers free coffee...a wine hour and milk and cookies at night. We would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Wonderful View”
Reviews.Author: CallaL
Reviews.Content: We got the top floor room with high ceiling and we could see bay bridge from our window. Although the room was small but it's very clean and comfortable. The location is great. We could walk to Ferris Building for breakfast then packed our things. Bad thing was you have to pay $40 for valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, perfect view.”
Reviews.Author: mcksh
Reviews.Content: Yes, our queen view room was small. Very small. But the view of the Bay Bridge was wonderful, the location couldn't be beat, great bed, and the service was terrific. We loved being in a reclaimed historic building (formerly the YMCA that served Army and Navy men preparing to ship out in WWII). Even the small size of the room took on new meaning when we realized that our fathers might well have stayed in it, or one just like it, years ago. It would be my choice again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Giants game”
Reviews.Author: Oatmans
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel located within an easy walking distance of the Giants ballpark. The lobby is beautifully decorated with a fireplace in the main sitting area. A couple of games were available to occupy ourselves. The coffee reception in the morning was a welcome treat. the room was your typical SF room - small, but well appointed. It had everything we needed. We especially enjoyed the location - an easy walk to AT&T Park and several dinner options.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, watch out for grumpy bellhops"”
Reviews.Author: CAtraveler_011
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently took an anniversary trip to San Francisco and stayed at the Harbor Court Hotel. As many have mentioned, the rooms are small, but cozy, clean and will fit your needs for a weekend away. Upon arriving, they provided us with a bottle of champagne and chocolates to celebrate our anniversary. We opted for a cheaper non-bay view room and were placed on the 8th floor. We had a nice city view looking up, but looking down our view was of the a/c and power units for the building. As a caution, you are able to hear the noisy outside a/c and power units from inside your room. However, your a/c inside the room will mask the sound, as it is loud too. Overall, it's not a deal breaker, just an annoyance. If youâ€™re a light sleeper, you may want to consider packing some ear plugs. The bed was quite comfy and the bathroom served our needs; although it was on the small side and could use updating. In booking the reservation, we were excited about the nightly wine reception. However, we ended up missing it all four nights -- bummer! Although, as we missed it by only 15 minutes one of the nights we asked the front desk if there was any wine left and he poured us each a glass. We didn't miss the fresh baked cookies each night though -- very yummy! They do serve coffee and tea in the morning, but no breakfast. Although, it would have been nice touch if they served a light continental breakfast. Be sure to register as an In-Touch Member (it's free); you'll get free Wi-Fi and $10 credit for the mini bar during your stay. As for the customer service, it was good â€“ nothing spectacular. When we arrived at the hotel the valet, Jason greeted us and helped us with our belongings. Throughout our stay, the front desk was helpful in answering our questions. The only issue came the day of our departure. Wanting to enjoy breakfast and a few more hours in the city, we opted to checkout around 10:30am and store our belongings with the hotel. Checkout is at noon, so we didn't want to hold up the room if we ran late. Upon asking for a cart to bring our things down, we received a very grumpy bellhop named Neil. At first, I figured he was just grumpy as it was likely a very busy day. However, his attitude did not improve once we returned a few hours later to get our bags and car from valet. Apparently, he was serving as a valet assistant too. We waited inside the hotel for him to retrieve our car. About 20 minutes later, he returned and I helped him carry our belongings. However, he ended up bringing the wrong vehicle and then questioned whether it was indeed the wrong car! As everything was now outside, we waited on the sidewalk for him to retrieve the correct car. My boyfriend stepped away for a minute, when Neil finally returned with our car. He parked the car in the street, abruptly grabbed our suitcase, and told me to follow (my cue to grab the rest of the bags and help out). As we had a number of items, we asked him if we could pull into a valet parking space and get situated before leaving for our 8 hour drive. He promptly rolled his eyes and asked us how long we thought it might take. Overall, I thought we were very polite, friendly, and helpful, while he was rude, curt, and unfriendly! For $30/day, plus tax I was not impressed with the valet service, especially since itâ€™s your only option with the hotel. Needless, to say our last impression of Harbor Court Hotel was not great. All in all, we did have a good stay. We enjoyed the location near the Ferry Building, Bay Bridge, and Muni Station. We look forward to another visit to San Francisco and may consider another stay at the Harbor Court Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, comfortable, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: kwpapers
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister on a holiday for five nights. Located in the Embarcadero, the price was reasonable compared to many similar hotels in the Union Square area. The location was actually perfect for us. Practically across the street from the Ferry Market Building, we went to the market often, and the Saturday farmer's market was a highlight. It was nice to be close to the water, and the Embarcadero was great for walking in both directions from the hotel. It was about a 20 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf, and a 20 minute walk to downtown. There were plentiful options for good restaurants near the hotel, albeit fewer than downtown. We walked everywhere, so walking a little farther for a restaurant was no big deal anyway. It was actually a bit of a relief to come back to a quiet hotel at the end of the day after spending the day fighting crowds and noise of the city. The hotel itself was clean, decorated nicely, and the staff was very nice and helpful. The room was small, but we didn't spend much time there, so it didn't matter. The king sized bed was wonderfully comfortable, and the pillows were good quality. The room had air conditioning, and large windows that opened. Our room was not facing the street, so there was no view, but it was blessedly quiet. We could barely hear noise of other guests at the hotel, either. The coffee service in the lobby in the morning was good, with both hot and iced coffee, teas, and hot chocolate. The wine reception in the evenings is a nice touch, and we made it there twice. In all, the only thing I wished that this hotel had was a coffee pot or kettle in the room. In the evenings, we were really wanting a cup of tea or hot chocolate in the room. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, except for people who are looking to go clubbing near their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home!(Only this one's on the bay)”
Reviews.Author: Gidyup2
Reviews.Content: One of my guilty pleasures while meeting in San Francisco is staying at the Harbor Court. This awesome boutique hotel has the most comfortable bed, wine reception, super staff, and close proximity to several resurants. It is my #1 choice for my monthly visit to the Bay Area. My office is just a walk away which is the reason i began staying here. But Neil and a few other long time staff members make it a home away from home. thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Very fun and welcoming hotel; loved the milk and cookies at night”
Reviews.Author: ButterflyInNYC
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at a Kimpton, and I love their boutique theme which is animal friendly, features a wine social hour every night, milk and cookies at bedtime and free coffee in the lobby in the morning. I am a HUGE fan of the leopard bath robes. Also, their guest rewards program is great because you get free internet and $10 of free stuff in the minibar. Our stay was a bit unexpected (we were stuck in SF due to hurricane Katrina), but the staff was very nice and made us feel at home. They provided us with free extra toothepaste and lots of hangers, which while I realize is a small thing made me very happy! Also there was a very nice YMCA literally attached to the building; great gym.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in SF's most perfect location”
Reviews.Author: keeptahoeblue
Reviews.Content: I booked a discounted queen room on Expedia for a single, Friday night stay for my husband and me. We took the ferry from Larkspur and this hotel is a half-block up the Embarcadero from the ferry building - and is an absolutely perfect SF location for anyone visiting the city. When we checked into our room, it did not have a view so I called the front desk to see if they had another room desk and they very graciously upgraded us to a king room (no charge) with a beautiful view of the Bay. Rooms are very small, but that's not surprising as it is a very old building and was once the YMCA (there's no workout room because guests get access to the fully remodeled, gorgeous Embarcadero Y adjacent). They have a lovely "living room" lobby with sofas and comfy chairs, and a complimentary beer and wine service in the evening. Milk and cookies at 9:30 as well, but as they are a half-block from Boulevard - one of the city's best restaurants - we didn't take them up on those. As the room is small, the very comfortable platform bed had huge drawers underneath to act as a dresser. Pluses: -Lovely linens -Excellent front desk service -Complimentary beer/wine in lounge, coffee/tea in morning -fabulous location, hands down the best home base in SF. If you are a tourist, you can access everything from here. -very clean -the house dog - a darling French Bulldog to greet you. Hotel is pet-friendly. -YMCA access -double-hung windows actually open. The Embarcadero is noisy but it was so much fun to watch the world go by and the thick walls and triple-glazed windows shut out the noise when we closed them before bed. -Warm, leopard-print robes -Bay view from many rooms Drawbacks: -This was a bummer: We requested room service breakfast for the 6:30-7:00 window - this was the earliest they offered and my husband was running a half-marathon at 8:00 am. The food and coffee didn't arrive until 7:10, which really sucked because drinking coffee and eating that close to a long run is not good. We would have gone to the lobby and gotten coffee had we known it was going to be late - they apologized but by then we had to gulp and run-literally. -We don't usually even turn on the TV but we wanted to watch the last inning of the Giants game. The TV had awful picture quality, very fuzzy. It wasn't the channel, either. -No coffeemaker in room -Small rooms, windows are small too, remember it is an old building and back in the day they wanted to keep heat in and noise/pollution out. Huge mirror the length of the wall makes it look a little bigger. -The room initially smelled like cigarettes when we checked in. Opening the windows solved that problem, but it was surprising as this is a non-smoking hotel. -$10 for wi-fi? Really? All in all, we would definitely stay here again, we had a wonderful time and it is near some of the best restaurants in the city and is a mile from AT&T park, but wouldn't rely on timely room service or getting the most from electronic devices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Neighborhood & cool perks!”
Reviews.Author: PHLChik
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great neighborhood with easy access to BART to get to other great neighborhoods. Plus it's directly across from the Bay & Ferry Building (bonus)! The rooms are small - trust me - I was even shocked when I got into the room after reading reviews that warned me of the size. BUT - we weren't even in the room much AND it was spotless - maid service was fantastic! The staff is a model for hotels everywhere - all smiles; remembering faces & names - they made us feel like we knew them for many years. The nightly happy hour was my favorite because we met people from all over the country & enjoyed our conversations over drinks. Thanks for a great stay - we will recommend this place to our friends/family & should we return to the West Coast, we will be there again! Can't wait for my next Kimpton stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mmcalea
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to San Francisco and stayed at the Harbor Court Hotel. What a great hotel and convenient location. The rooms are very clean and modern. They have an excellent staff that just can't do enough for you. Kevin, the hotel manager, went above and beyond to assist us with everything from recommendations for restaurants to booking us a room with the most beautiful view of the Bay Bridge. The hotel perks are an added bonus and include mornng coffee, evening happy hour and cookies and milk for a late night snack. The rooms are a little cozy, but the perks and the great room near the front desk surely compensate. The hotel offers package deals and we took advantage of the one that included a chocolate tour. Definitely recommend this package...., great hotel rate with the tour for 2 people included!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly place”
Reviews.Author: katiekins570
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had an excellent experience at this hotel. We had a lot of luggage, and the first room we got was really small, so we inquired about an upgrade. For $20/night more, we got a more spacious room and were much happier. The room was comfortable and stylish (though still a bit on the small side). I try to stay in Kimpton hotels if I can--I like the complimentary wine receptions, the free wi-fi (if you join the members program, which is free), my favorite newspaper at my door... we always find the service and amenities excellent. The location was good--less central than it could be, but we were right by the Bay Bridge and the market in the Ferry Building, and close to Chinatown etc. It took a while to get down to the Mission in the evenings to see friends, but we were close to BART and Muni stops, so public transportation was a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, great gym access”
Reviews.Author: AJD_CA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times on business. The hotel definitely has a "boutique -y" feel, as distinguished from hotels that are more full service, business, etc. The rooms do not have coffee makers, for example, but they will happily bring you hot water or tea at any time. The robes in the closet are, instead of the usual white terry cloth, funky leopard-print robes. Some people will love this; some will not. The location is lovely -- right near the SF Ferry building, and the lobby is is also quite nice. The hotel does not have its own gym but does have privileges with the adjacent YMCA -- a huge facility with cardio machines, weights, etc. The cardio machines face a window looking out onto SF Bay, which is very nice, and there's good jogging nearby as well. In sum, a high quality boutique hotel located near the Ferry Building, with access to a great gym. Some of the rooms have gorgeous views of SF Bay.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: SusieB60
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took a trip to San Francisco and we couldn't be happier with our choice of hotel. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. The room was spacious enough and very clean. The bed linens were wonderful and the bed very comfortable. Enjoyed the complimentary wine, the cookies/milk served in the lobby. The location was great for us. It is near the Ferry Building and the fabulous restaurant, Boulevard is on the corner. Would defintely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, good-looking hotel at a great location.”
Reviews.Author: hankpop
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work. The staff were friendly, the hotel attractive and comfortable. I had a room with a stunning view of the ocean. When I wasn't working, I walked down to AT&T Park and saw part of a baseball game. The food at the nearby Ferry Building is great. I got a super yummy egg and cheese on a baguette for breakfast. I also took a really good yoga class at the YMCA next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ferris5
Reviews.Content: Small but absolutely adequate room for the price. Great bed. Decent location near the Ferry Building. One of the free SF Library tours even goes through the lobby. Nice happy hour. i will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, efficient hotel at a historical and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: JandJMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We arrived tired from a long flight from Australia, to a warm welcome from the staff at the Harbor Court. Even though it was quite early our room was ready, and their welcome set us up for a great 5 night stay. Yes, the room was a little small, but we knew that beforehand, and everything else about the hotel made up for it. We enjoyed the Happy Hour in the evenings, just the thing to relax us after a day of exploring all the many delights that San Francisco has to offer.The young,hip staff happily reconfirmed our bookings for a Sonoma Vallry Wine Tour with Terrific Tours, and a walk in the Muir Woods with Tom, both of which were wonderful. The location of the hotel so close to the Ferry Building was a great plus, and we enjoyed the restaurants and the Farmer's Market, also it was close to the Amtrak Building from where we departed from to start our journey accross the USA. The Harbor Court Hotel was a fantastic introduction to a wonderful trip to the USA, and we would love to stay there again, and have told our friends and family about it.

Reviews.Title: “This may be our new SF spot”
Reviews.Author: querque1
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Harbor Court. All in all there is a lot to commend the place and we may make this our regular San Fran hotel. LOCATION: The location is superb - near the water and the fabulous Ferry Building makes for cool breezes and affordable breakfasts and snacks. It was great to have the farmer's market across the street. It's away from the Ghiradelli Square area that gets noisy and sometimes unsavory. Also one of us had a knee injury so it was nice to be able to get out and walk places without immediately encountering hills. I've stayed at the Fairmont and boutique hotels downtown, and walking anywhere is definitely a chore from those places if you are temporarily or permanently disabled. Tons of buses come within two blocks, and BART and Muni are also right there, so we didn't rent a car and took public transport everywhere. ROOMS: Definitely spring for the bay view room - the view is spectacular. Since, as many of the reviews mention, the rooms are small, having that expansive view opens up the room in a really nice way. The bed was comfortable enough and the room was clean. The cleaning staff was actually great about accommodating our needs given that we were needing big bags of ice and strange room cleaning times. SERVICE AND AMENITIES: The service was good without being over the top. If you like fawning service, this may not be for you. But if you like friendliness and helpfulness from young, energetic people, this is a good fit. We enjoyed the little touches - flavored waters all day, coffee in the morning, the cookies in the evening, Aveda products in room, and they even brought up a bottle of wine for the birthday we were celebrating! I loved having the YMCA as the gym- so convenient and even though it's $10 a day it's totally worth it if you want to have real workouts (more than a treadmill and some 10 lb. weights) while you are away. I also liked having the little Japanese restaurant attached - it was convenient and decent food. VALUE: If you like a big room, you will find this to be pricey and disappointing. However, if your key components are location and service, then the price is right. Become a Klimpton program member and you don't have to pay the surcharge for wireless. I booked through the website and got as good of a deal as from any travel site. Given that we didn't need to rent a car and had easy access to cheap food, I would say the value was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for business travelers and tourists”
Reviews.Author: chumleyjones
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Hotels.com based on the positive reviews from other travelers. I was not disappointed. This is modest sized hotel with clean rooms and very professional staff. I booked a double room, which was on the small side. But the room had plenty of modern touches, including a flat screen tv, and iPod clock radio. Wifi is free in the room provided you sign up for the hotel's frequent guest program. The location is right across the street from the Ferry Building so I had plenty of dining choices nearby. I had a business meeting in the Embarcadero Center, which was only a short walk away. This is definitely a 3.5 to 4 star property and much cheaper than comparable hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel . . . only if sleep is not important”
Reviews.Author: WanderersHappy
Reviews.Content: Harbor Court's location is convenient for the Embarcadero. Rooms, while small, are clean and well-serviced. The lobby is reasonably attractive, as is the lounge, where seemingly reluctant staff preside over a complimentary but subdued wine hour in the evening. What's bizarre is that this floor boasts no restrooms, leaving guests to be sent from the lounge through a connecting door into the adjacent YMCA building, where not one sign will direct you. This is how to make guests feel unwelcome. Even with a quiet room request, beware booking online - you will probably be allocated a room overlooking an internal courtyard of A/C units, with giant cylinders mere inches from several room windows. These cylinders hum non-stop and sleep will be elusive. The noise is not unlike that aboard an airliner. That good rate you thought you had scored will not feel so great once you are sleep-deprived. Seeing another guest changing rooms when we checked in should have been a red flag. We guess this must happen all the time. Previous Kimpton hotels were great, but this was a huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Little perks to make you happy”
Reviews.Author: wisechildVan
Reviews.Content: I had to make a last minute booking because the original hotel I booked in San Fran was a slum. Luckily this hotel showed up with a promotional price and I was happy to transfer. I have stayed at a Kimpton hotel before and I love the chain. I was at the hotel within 15 minutes of my online booking and they had my reservation. Because it was last minute, the room they had for me was quite small, but they offered me a free bottle of wine, which was what I needed after my little hotel booking fiasco. Check-in and out was quick, smooth, painless. They also have a free "happy hour" in the lounge with free wine, free coffee in the mornings, and free lemon or orange-infused water 24/7. Free wi-fi access when you sign up for their loyalty program, and free bicycle rentals. I love that they have complimentary Aveda products. My friend (who lives in San Fran) ended up staying with me because it was such a nice hotel and they had a complimentary toothbrush, toothpaste, and razor for him. Very cozy and romantic for couples. They are also pet-friendly with dog treats in the lobby. They moved me to a bigger room after the first night and even offered to move my bags for me while I was out. Service was prompt, courteous, thoughtful, excellent. Rooms are clean and up to their boutique hotel standard of excellence, keeping in mind it is an older hotel. The only negative experience was that they were doing construction next door while I was there so you can hear the jackhammering in the daytime. It is across the street from the Ferry Building so you can wander over there for some great culinary exploring, but if you want to go shopping, you need to take a streetcar to Union Square, so it's not that close. Also, they don't have an onsite gym and pool but you get complimentary use of the YMCA facilities which are next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: PaulSVegas
Reviews.Content: Look if you're coming to SF on vacation to stay in your room the whole time this probably isn't the right place. The rooms are really small but they tell you that on their site, they give you the sq ft for each room, and when they say 164 sq ft they mean it. Our room was tiny but it didn't matter. We were only paying like $150/night in SF, that's a steal. We were mostly only in the room to sleep or get ready. If you can't find other stuff to be doing in SF, then get a life or pony up the extra scratch and book a luxury hotel. The Harbour Court nails it's demographic, young, hip, adventurous, budget conscious travelers looking for some amenities but nothing overwhelming. My wife and I had a great time. The location is the embarcadero which is great if most of your activities are up north but with all the public trans in SF it turned out to be easy to navigate the entire city from there. The staff is extremely friendly and were as helpful as they could be. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again. If you stay here and don't like the staff, something is wrong with YOU, trust me.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Staff, Great Location & Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: poleinahole1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights over a weekend based on Trip Advisor reviews. They were on the money reporting the super friendly and helpful staff; small but stylish rooms and great location. I will stay here again next time I am in SF as I feel I got value for money. Wifi is supposed to be an extra $10 a day but they provided this for free--they give you a print out with the monthly passcode so I suspect this is a general frieebie if you ask. Note that phone signal from my room (509) overlooking the airconditioning units and fire escape was very weak, so if you require calls to your mobile for business purposes you might want to upgrade to a harbor view room. The hotel has two computers in the lobby you can use to print out boarding passes (free) or surf the web (charge). The hotel doesn't have a healthclub but you can buy a pass for $10 a day to use at the YMCA next door (a door from the hotel lobby leads right into the YMCA). The YMCA isn't open 24 hours a day, but the benefit is you get to use a much better range of equipment than a hotel would normally have.
