I didn't do the cocktail reception, late night cookies or morning coffee, but did like the ice tea and orange and lemon water juice in the lobby, as well as the fire they had going there. Even in summer it gives a cozy touch. As others have mentioned, the Farmer's Market is a five minute walk and is a great place to get breakfast on Tuesday and Saturday and be part of the SF scene as you mingle with locals. Margaritaville is an SF institution and people line up for their freshly made Mexican food and eggs first thing in the morning because it gets too popular at lunch time. Opposite is an organic breakfast place that does great oatmeal and fresh fruit juices. There are loads of good restaurants around the hotel (the Embarcadero Towers boast several upscale Asian and Indian eateries) and it is a 20 minute walk to Union Square. The hotel has carved out a niche for itself by being pet friendly (they even offer guided dog walks!) and over the weekend, about 15% of guests have pets. Yet the hotel is immaculately clean and the rooms don't smell. I highly recommend this friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!! Can't wait to go back :-)”
Reviews.Author: kristadmiscevich
Reviews.Content: Harbor Court Hotel in San Francisco is perfectly located! Close to trolley lines and buses. As well as many wonderful places withing walking distance. The Ferry Building across the street has an amazing farmers market on Tues. , Thurs & Sat. You can walk right out the back door and be right along the water! You can catch a ferry to Sausalito right there without having to go to the crowded Fisherman's Warf. The hotel is contemporary, comfortable & just really, really cool!!! :-) Great complimentary coffee in the morning, a free wine & beer happy hour at 5! and milk and cookies @ 9 :-) Loved everything about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShariJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice with a friendly and helpful staff. Our room had a view of the Bay Bridge. The room was a little small but had enough room for two of us to move around. They have a nice wine and beer happy hour in the evenings. It was close to the Ferry Building. Which has a fun Saturday and Tuesday Farmers Market. Would stay there again when in SF.

Reviews.Title: “"Sheets are kinda scratchy"”
Reviews.Author: BarXTraveler
Reviews.Content: The regular rooms are tiny. After placing two bags on the floor, you have essentially no open floor space. As a current resident of NYC, I am used to small spaces but this room is just too cramped. The other main complaint is the quality of the bed linens - every time I moved, it sounds like I was rolling around in a stack of newspapers. The location is great since you are near the Bay Bridge, ballpark, and some nice restaurants/shops along the Embarcadero. As with Kimpton hotels, you get the free lobby happy hours, so that is always a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Once Again, a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: BedandBreakfastFan56
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Harbor Court, and this time we stayed 4 nights (the first time we stayed one night). It is a wonderful place to stay, located near so many of San Francisco's sites. The staff is helpful and friendly. We also enjoyed visiting the Farmer's Market on Thursday and Saturday mornings, just across the street. Harbor Court is clean and quiet, our two top requirements. We love the location, it is within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf, cable cars, Ghirardelli's Chocolate Company, AT&T Park, and the Bay Bridge. We also enjoyed the nightly wine hour as well as the delicious morning coffee each day. This time we splurged and went to the YMCA next door for a workout, it overlooks the bay. Working out with a view was a pleasure. Overall, we highly recommend Harbor Court. It makes visiting San Francisco a double pleasure, living in a comfortable hotel as well as being within walking distance of so many popular attractions. Check it out and I'm sure you'll agree.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: bamafutbal
Reviews.Content: small room but big bathroom for size of room. great view of the bridge

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but watch out for room 410 - very noisy”
Reviews.Author: marklaing
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel yesterday. Friendly staff, clean, superb location, facilities very cool. I got a Priceline package so got slotted into one of those interior rooms with a wall two feet away for a view. That's fine, it was a business trip so I didn't need a view but I did need some sleep. Alas at the crack of dawn the pipes started rattling or gurgling for about an hour and I couldn't sleep through this. I even taped it on my phone\video it was so weird. Sounded like large rocks rolling down an interior pipe. I mentioned it to a somewhat sheepish concierge who said it was the "YMCA", some exercise machine. Really. Apart from that a great place and spectacular rear entrance to the bay with view of San Mateo bridge is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was fabulous, nothing was too much trouble for the staff, we highly recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: andhowlancs
Reviews.Content: The location is superb, make sure you ask for a room facing the bridge. Loved the dressing gowns. Kevin who checked us in was great and the free drinks between 5-6 pm in the lounge area was another bonus. Trams along to Pier 39 are picked up just around the corner and the city centre is within easy walking distance. Just perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: NJtraveler069
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed by the location of this hotel! Located on the Embarcadero, the views out of the premiem rooms of the bridge and the port are outstanding! Public transportation is the way to go. The map from the front desk was easy to read and made it a snap to figure out how to navigate the city. A car is not necessary and is very expensive to keep there. Had we known that it was $40 a night to keep our car, we would have returned it to the rental agency prior to staying here. We did not use it at all during our 3 day stay. If using a rental car, make sure it's tank is full prior to returning it. We couldn't find a gas station on our way to the airport and payed a hefty $95 price tag for not having a full tank (although it was 3/4 full.) Have singles on hand for the busses. It's $2 per person for 90 minutes of use. We took them to the Fisherman's warf (the "F" right out front), and across town to the Cliff House for lunch (the "38" bus lets you off within a short walk to the restaurant.) The trolly was a must do! Be sure to wear your walking shoes. The front desk staff was very helpful in providing recommendations of places to see in the city. The room itself was not very large, but the bed was comfortable. There are no vending machines for soda's etc, but the mini bar is stocked with drinks and snacks. There is no restaurant within the hotel, and room service was from the Japanese restaurant next door.

Reviews.Title: “Our Third Stay at the Harbor Court”
Reviews.Author: MMouseAlumni
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay(16 nights total) at the Harbor Court Hotel since October. We stayed in a queen size room with a view of the Bay Bridge this time. The view was very good. We could see the bridge from our right window and the Oakland Ferry boat dock near the Ferry Building on our right. The rooms are smaller, yet are very comfortable. Decor is very nice and unique to the older building. The queen bed sleeps awesome and has storage drawers to hold your clothes. Hotel guests get free internet when you join the Kimpton club. Free coffee and tea in the morning and a wine reception from 5-6. The staff is very friendly and the location has 5 great restaurants on the block. The location is the best reason to stay here. The hotel is a 15 minute walk to the San Francisco Giants. The F line is a 2 minute walk from the hotel. This is great because it is a little closer than the Ferry building and you can get on before it fills up with passengers at the Ferry building. The F line goes to Fisherman's Wharf in one direction and to Union Square in the other direction.

Reviews.Title: “Not like the other Kimptons”
Reviews.Author: OceanLove3
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on Priceline and only after "winning" it were we made aware of the fact that this hotel only has rooms with 1 bed so if you are traveling with 2 people that are not related, you will have to share a bed. Never had that experience before and really you shouldn't offer yourself on PL unless you can sleep 2 guests. That said, on to the actual hotel. The rooms are tiny, it feels like you're in a closet. I don't think I've ever been in a room this small. It makes all the hotel rooms in Europe seem large! The location was ok and we were able to find free parking on the street since it was a Saturday night. I guess if you're traveling with your pet, this is the place to be. We love Kimptons because they are dog friendly, though we did not have ours with us when we traveled. Would I stay here again? Only if I was traveling with my husband, don't really want to share a bed with other people ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hmbfox2
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. This building was the original YMCA on the Embarcadero, I believe the lobby was designed by Julia Morgan. You walk out the front door and are on the bay, across from the Ferry Building. Very friendly desk staff, the wine at 5:00 brought on a large number of people and a very friendly, lively atmosphere. This hotel is very convenient to AT&T Park (or what ever it is called this year) and a game had just ended, so maybe that was it. The room was small, but very nicely appointed, comfortable and the elevator always came quickly. Big hint: We parked on the street across from the front (back?) door of the hotel on Steuart at 4:00 on a Saturday, paid for two hours of parking and that was it. Free parking after 6:00 and free on Sunday. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Small room - Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld010
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Harbor Court and loved it. The room is tiny but the bed was extremely comfortable, the linens were clean every day, the towels were thick and worth using, the people at the front desk were extremely friendly and kind and helpful. We had free wine every eve from 5-6pm and warm cookies and milk at 9pm. Nice touch!! We had WIFI and even the "goodies" in the bath were a nice product - not junk for your hair or cheap soap. A bit high priced but it's San Francisco so worth it. Minutes to the Ferry Building which is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel_globetrotter
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel right on the edge of the Embarcadero. Perfect location for strolling along the water front, looking around the Ferry Building or heading up to Market Street. There are cable cars on the corner of the road so you can be across the other side of the city in minutes. The hotel itself was great - very comfortable and clean. Good value for money. The hotel staff were great. The only downside was the public internet computers were not working and would have cost $8 for 15 mins which was definitely on the steep side. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “used to live in SF and every time i return we always stay at harbor court”
Reviews.Author: travelasalocal
Reviews.Content: So the New York Times travel section shared Harbor Court with the entire world so I figured that I might as well tell everyone that we always stay here when we visit SF. I used to live in the Mission District and the Inner Richmond and HC is great as it is coveniently located to mass transit and to get anywhere in the city, SFO, and the East Bay. The rooms are well appointed (with Aveda products!) and very comfortable. The Ferry Building and its Farmers Market are perfect for stocking up on snacks or grabbing a delicious quick bite or a not so quick bite (Slanted Door=food heaven).

Reviews.Title: “Has more dogs as guests than humans and the rooms are tiny”
Reviews.Author: Shuffle01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in May 2011, as part of our California road trip. We picked this one because it has good views of Bay Bridge however, the small windows really let the view down. The rooms are very small and were the smallest we came across on our two week trip. We could not believe how many dogs were trotting about with the guests. I can only presume this is one of the reasons it is so popular, because of all the dog owners rating it highly. For those without dogs with them, it strikes you as very odd. The staff were generally quite rude and unhelpful. And finally, there are no tea or coffee making facilities in the room but you can get free luke warm/cold tea and coffee from the lobby in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it!”
Reviews.Author: FabulousGigi
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd time we have stayed a night at the Harbor Court while attending a Friday night and Saturday Giant's game. The hotel has friendly, helpful staff and a fabulous location: easy walking distance to AT & T Park. Breakfast across the street at the Farmer's Market. Parking is only $20 if you have a hybrid!

Reviews.Title: “Cute Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amg_2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when our friends let us know last minute that we would not be able to stay with them as planned. The hotel is near to the Ferry Plaza and bus/streetcar lines, so tourism is no problem! It is also very well appointed, and the complimentary coffee in the morning and wine tasting were quite nice. I will say that the room was small. Not unbearably so by any means, but keep in mind that this is a smaller hotel that is going to have older, smaller rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Smart but too noisy”
Reviews.Author: mikes1901
Reviews.Content: Rated a four star hotel, the standard rooms were as plush as expected. Though I didnâ€™t have one, I would expect the bay bridge view rooms to have a good view having now seen the position of the hotel. The staff were very efficient and helpful especially as I had to change my room twice within my two night stay â€“ and therein is my biggest disappointment with this hotel â€“ a number of the rooms are right next to some large air conditioning units (especially for neighbouring buildings) and the continuous roar from these was not a pleasant night time accompaniment. On the second night I was moved to the seventh floor where it was quieter but still not perfect. Breakfast is served in the room. As a single traveller this was not a problem but had there been someone sharing the room with me it would have started to get fairly claustrophobic with both trying to have breakfast at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Unique stay in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: RenoRobbie
Reviews.Content: You'll enjoy a wonderful sleep on their "super" comfortable beds. The linens are luxurious. The rooms are quite small but have that special decorator touch which is a Kimpton Hotel trademark. Spend the extra money and get a BAY VIEW. Ours was on the 7th floor and reminded me of a cruise ship. You could lie in bed and see the lighted "Bay Bridge" and harbor with complete privacy. The rooms were quiet because of the "double hung" windows. The "cookies and milk" are worth the stay by themselves. The lobby has a lovely fireplace going, and bright, fun decorator items well placed amongst comfortable seating. Join the "Kimpton-in-Touch" Club. Nice perks and no extra charge. We were there 3 nights and ate at Perry's our first night. Try their "chicken and biscuit dinner. Also had an excellent breakfast at Perry's. It would be nice if they had coffee makers in the room, BUT they do have it available in the lobby along with a good selection of newspapers. We brought our little "immersion" coffee maker and Starbuck's Via. That did it until be got downstairs. If you need a lot of room this "cozy" space might not be your cup of tea. This is pretty typical of old historical hotels that have been renovated in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but absolute pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: savvychef
Reviews.Content: It was great to return to the Harbor Court last week- arrived early, stashed my luggage, and headed off to Ferry Terminal. Hotel associates had made a number of suggestions for where to go, what to do and see. Only downside was doing business on Tuesday, thus missing the Farmers' Market. The upside: location, location, location for a most wonderful city! Thanks again for the extra touches- massage, wine pourings, and 'cookies and milk' @ days' end.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: MattClay
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little hotel in a great location. The place was spotless, with a friendly and personal welcome and hip decoration. The hotel is in a first class location. Kimpton have nice touches such as free cookies and milk in the evening and a complimentary wine hour. If you're there on a Saturday the nearby Ferry Market is a must - organic food and yummy baked goodies and coffee. Parking was $40 plus tip for valet - there is no alternative free parking nearby. The 'smallness' though had its drawbacks - there is no toilet in the lobby, no breakfast served downstairs (though they do serve it for room service) and some of the rooms are very small. Despite this I would recommend it: the positives substantially outweigh the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room but very Chic”
Reviews.Author: cmoncymru
Reviews.Content: Small room but adequate,some nice touches,great sleep quality and good service,good position for sea front & Union Square

Reviews.Title: “Tries hard to be boho and chic but it's stiff, tired, tiny and way overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Goneilluk
Reviews.Content: It's not stunning. It's average. And although it is on the waterfront, of course, the majority of the matchbox sized rooms look onto "views" a lot less pleasing on the eye, like neighboring buildings or air con units. Staff are courteous. They're just doing their job. No more than that. It's redeeming feature is it's convenient location. Would I stay there again? Probably not. Shame!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beyond a typical stay, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: konigsberg
Reviews.Content: First, as a hotel right next to the Embarcadero and the Ferry Farmer's Market, this place has a great location, not to mention being right next to Yank Sing, one of my favorite San Francisco restaurants. (It's also three blocks from the office I visit when in town.) The room is comfortable. Not very big, but I don't need a lot of space. The pillows are my kind of comfortable, where they don't puff out and put a crick in my neck. The front desk has been continually helpful with nearby recommendations. I really have no issues with this hotel - it is my new go-to hotel for my trips to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a better experience.”
Reviews.Author: mccallumot
Reviews.Content: This is defiantly the best hotel that I have experienced in San Francisco. Came here for my birthday weekend and I couldn't have been any more pleased. The hotel is perfectly located in the embarcadero with beautiful views of the bay bridge and the water. There are plenty of great restaurants and sights to see near by, so I couldn't have really asked for a better location. The staff was very helpful, polite and professional. The actual hotel boasts wonderful personality and includes free coffee in the morning as well as cookies and milk at night. The room couldn't have been any better with wonderful views of the bay. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to San Fran and I couldn't have been more pleased with my experience at the Harbor Court Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel - highly recommend! Great property and staff”
Reviews.Author: willicr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Harbor Court a dozen times in the last year. It is simply a wonderful hotel. Very comfortable and quiet. Comfy beds, nice linens, super amenities. The staff is also excellent - Jen Mah, Kevin Bodalian and Nicole Morales know me on a first name basis and consistently provide outstanding service. I also must give recognition to the hotel's management - Jason Stone runs a top-notch hotel. If business or pleasure takes you to SF, you should stay at the Harbor Court!! By the way, the YMCA (coed gym) next store is really nice too. You can exercise while looking at the Bay Bridge and people running the Embarcadero.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing on many levels”
Reviews.Author: FeedTheWorld
Reviews.Content: TINY room. Decent location ONLY if you want to be near the Ferry Building. But if you want to be in a fun/active part of town at night this ain't the place. The staff were unfriendly; they couldn't be bothered to smile or say "good morning" or "good evening" at any time during our almost 1-week stay. They were also unhelpful; no good suggestions or advice was offered at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: kuroimonkey
Reviews.Content: I really like the fact that the hotel had valet parking. It's a real pain trying to find parking in the neighbourhood. Typically the cost of parking per day in SF at a hotel is $50 + tax, which is the norm. The receptionist said that there was a free wine reception, however we chose to skip this in favour of going to dinner. We didn't ask for a room with a view, since we though we'd be so tired from the flight we'd need all the sleep we can get. The room was small, but nice. The hotel had free wi-fi which was great for people with multiple devices. The room was quiet and comfortable. I wouldn't have expected to pay $6 for a large bottle of water when you can go down to Walgreen's and get a bottle for less. You can easily walk to the Embaradero and Union Square. I would stay here again. I would also recommend the Japanese restaurant next door to the hotel, which you can get room service from.

Reviews.Title: “Sumptuous Pampering for You and Pets!”
Reviews.Author: sb_jonathan
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of Harbor Court, about 18 months after my first review. I just wanted to tell you this hotel remains FABULOUS! They are extremely accommodating when it comes to pet guests, but the maintenance and housekeeping are so flawless - you would never know this facility welcomes pets with open arms! In other words, you don't have to choose between high quality or traveling with your pet family members - you get both! The decor is chich, the staff ultra friendly, the wine hour very fun, and the morning coffee is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cozy, would stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: SLurk
Reviews.Content: I searched and searched for hotels and came across this Harbor Court thanks to previous travelers and reviews on Tripadvisor. I can tell you they didn't let me down! My husband and I were only there for one night but we enjoyed our stay greatly! I give this hotel a strong A!

Reviews.Title: “What a fun, funky, comfortable, affordable, and perfectly located hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lflrpa
Reviews.Content: Thank you Academic Ambassadors for introducing me to the Harbor. I had a room with a terrific view of the Bay Bridge that was beautifully appointed, clean, and comfortable. I was afraid the room would feel small, but it had everything I needed and more! The staff is warm and friendly, and I was as happy as a lark!

Reviews.Title: “The Harbor Court feels like a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: CBB2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbor Court for four nights at the end of January. Our selection was made largely on location as we wanted to be near the Ferry Terminal to take a ferry to Napa and they bus to Amtrak. The hotel exceeded our expectations. It is impeccably clean and well maintained. They staff is quietly friendly, polite and helpful. The rooms, while only 168 sq. ft., are well designed and furnished and don't feel cramped at all. We had a harbor view room and it added to the overall enjoyment of stay, watching the people traffic on the Embarcadero below, and the bay and bridge beyond. The Manager's wine reception is a nice friendly touch. Before leaving, we decided that we will come back the next time we are in San Francisco. By the way, the market at the Ferry Terminal was a highlight of our visit to San Francisco. Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: brion8
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a breeze. Valet parking. The room was definitely small, but still very nice. Everything was clean and new looking. The bathroom was very nice. It has the bowed shower curtain rod, which I like, since I don't like having the shower curtain stick to me while showering. Good water pressure and hot water supply. TV was small, but no big deal. Bed was very comfortable. Room was very quiet as well. Loved the location right on The Embarcadero. Free wine reception from 5-6pm was very fun. 20 minute walk to Union Square for shopping. A few cab rides to other destinations were never over $10. We paid $119 for a Saturday night... a great deal! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the hotel and loved Frisco!”
Reviews.Author: renatofalzoni
Reviews.Content: You must go to San Francisco. And if you do, this is a nice hotel to stay. I got a room with a view for a good price on v It is in a great location. You can walk, bike or cable hide to any where. The free wine is very nice and you can chat with other guests and get to know new people.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with a lot of terrific perks!”
Reviews.Author: wayfarjim
Reviews.Content: Beautiful bay side location, complimentary coffee in the morning, wine reception in the evening, and milk and cookies at 9PM. Need I say more? Our queen room on the 8th floor was surprisingly much more spacious than I was expecting from some of the reviews. Although we didn't splurge on a bay view, we had a terrific view of downtown. Both the room size and view were superior to the one we had at Monaco (another Kimpton property at Union Square) a few years back. The Harbor Court is my new favorite hotel in San Francisco. We loved coming back each day to the crackling fireplace in their wonderful lobby/living room - and the treats! Staff is professional and friendly, although a little reserved which may be why some reviewers seem to indicate they seem aloof or uncaring. But the fact that the coffee, wine, and cookies are served on time each day, rooms are spotless, and we got all of our questions answered at the front desk easily and promptly, shows that the staff is truly top notch. We met some wonderful staff members, including Brad at the front desk and Michael at wine hour, who clearly work hard to ensure the comfort of guests. Our stay was not without glitches, but the hotel handled these issues very well. Due to high winds and pouring rain, we returned our first night to find a power outage in the hotel. The staff more than made up for this issue by passing out glow sticks which was a lot of fun, and pouring more complimentary wine! In fact, the power outage turned out to be one of the highlights of our trip. The atmosphere was very romantic sitting in the dark lobby in front of the fireplace, and as we made our way up the staircase to our room, we found that staff had lit the entire 8 floors with glow sticks which was very clever and pretty. In the AM we had lukewarm water to shower in, but PG&E did not get the power turned back on until 6:30 AM which was not the hotels fault. We also had a lamp that quit working during our stay, but a maintenance worker came immediately (at 10 PM none the less), assessed the problem and had it fixed for us - all in a span of about 20 minutes. If we have one complaint at all about the Harbor Court, it is that it is somewhat removed from the hustle and bustle of Union Square. BUT, we knew this before booking, and we chose the serene Embarcadero location instead as we wanted to be on the water. Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf and the other San Francisco attractions are all within walking distance, and/or less than 10 minutes away by either the F Line streetcars or BART. It is also right next to the Ferry Building which has a number of places to eat, Peet's Coffee and a farmers market on 3 days of the week. The quiet location also made for a wonderful nights rest. One tip on San Francisco in general. If you plan to do a cable car trip during the day, take the F Line to Fisherman's Wharf and catch it there. The lines at Powell/Market were close to 2 hours when we went at 11 AM. No wait at all at Taylor Street at Fisherman's Wharf. The California Street cable car (which starts a few blocks from the hotel) is currently not running due to work being done. To summarize, the Harbor Court is a wonderful hotel, with terrific "extras," a great staff, and a peaceful location on the bay. I would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for prince”
Reviews.Author: JungleKatPC
Reviews.Content: I arrived very late in the evening because of delayed flights. I had a conference at the Ferry building so I couldn't change to a better hotel. When I got into the room I thought they were kidding. It is so tiny the chair could not be pulled out from the desk. It was poorly lit, rusty water stains on tacky drop ceiling, crappy old mattress dressed up in a nice duvet, a small dark closet in the corner that was honestly scary. The shower head wasn't screwed on and fell off when I went to take a shower. There was a piece of toilet paper sticking out from behind the minny bar, it wasn't well maintained. I called the front desk and asked them to bring something up off their courtesy list and it never arrived! There is no coffee in the room and none in the lobby by 10:00 AM, if you want a coffee at 10:15 you need to go to the Ferry building. It was just not user-friendly. I expect a hotel that goes for this price to have a new mattress, no water stains, great lighting, and enough room to open a suitcase. I expect prompt, friendly service. I just didn't get it. i was really, really dissappointed by how poor of a value this place is. It isn't that this place is terrible, it would be a good room at about $70 or $80 dollars a night - maybe $100 in the high season. However, you are getting completely ripped off if you pay more than $100 for it.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: DC/VATravelGirl
Reviews.Content: I have never ever been disappointed by a Kimpton hotel and I can say the same for the Harbor Court. The location across from the Ferry Terminal is fantastic and the trolley runs right outside the door although we took a lovely walk to Fisherman's Wharf for some exercise. The staff was excellent and accommodating, the wine hour was lovely and appreciated and the room was fine. Be prepared for a smallish room, which didn't bother me, but the bed is comfy and they were happy to quickly deliver "Jack" the goldfish to my room for company! :) I have to say the bathroom could have used a little sprucing up as there were some spots and such on the wallpaper but overall the room was very clean and comfortable. For business or leisure travel this Kimpton is a great choice. Another plus is that it's right next door to Chaya one of SF's most popular restaurants! Also, if you're not a Kimpton In Touch member sign up now! You get a $10 raid the mini-bar card and extra special service!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RepRoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and 11 month old and I stayed for one night on our way back to SFO to Pittsburgh after driving down the CA coast. With a baby and the complimentary pack n' play, the hotel room was just too small. As with all Kimptons in my opinion it was a beautiful decor and cozy feeling. Just a "space" warning to those with little ones! Housekeeper was very kind and Luis the concierge was helpful and friendly :)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: travelfreak2007
Reviews.Content: Yes - regular rooms are small but got upgraded to penthouse suite. only paid $149 per night. Wow. Living room/bedroom set up facing the water with floor to ceiling windows overlooking the bay bridge. Balcony (if you climb out the big windows). Service as always at kimpton is top notch. You have a loyal fan. You must sign up for intouch program for free wifi and $10 free mini bar purchase. All is quiet and beds are super comfy. I also stay at Kimpton on post street (prescott) - both properties are great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: penntf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to come into SF at the last minute and were able to secure a great rate. The wine hour was fantastic and the location is even better. It's right across the street from the bay bridge and Ferry Building. This could be the best location in the city. Are room was a little small, but that's to be expected from a city boutique hotel. All in all, great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; small rooms; just fine for me, though”
Reviews.Author: dprreal
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Harbor Court earlier this year. The hotel is a block off of the Embarcadero, and quite well-appointed. Other reviewers have commented on the cozy-ness of the rooms. I'd agree; for an adult or two no problem unless you need to spread out, but I found it cramped to even use the desk. Definitely not a family hotel unless they have larger rooms (which I didn't ask about.) Next door restaurant Perry's for breakfast; fine but nothing to return to. High point was the very convenient location -- I'd go back if I needed to be near the Embarcadero, but would look for a different place if I brought the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Service needs improving”
Reviews.Author: jo952
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay here , with their wine hour at 6 and the cookies and milk at 9 what more could you ask for. Well a good question, the service provided by most the staff was below standard to that you would expect from an American Hotel. The only member of staff that exceeded my expectations was Luis, he was the bell boy aswell as the receptionist . He made the visit, he helped with places to go for drinks and places to eat. The other members of staff were not able to assist in any way and they also didnt carry out the services that they offered. All in all I would return to San Francisco but only if Luis was running this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel near Financial District”
Reviews.Author: NapaPaul
Reviews.Content: This is a decent boutique hotel and fairly priced. Just be prepared for small rooms, inconvenient steps between lobby and elevators (not easy with suitcases), and be ready to walk or cab it to Financial District and restaurants. Many amenities such as free YMCA fitness center access (next door), milk and cookies at night, wine reception in evening make it worthwhile. No in-room coffee makers but free coffee in hotel lounge. Tight rooms make it not kid friendly but there are bathtubs. Staff tends to be unfriendly, "too cool for school" attitude. Free wifi only for returning guests.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room with a Bay Bridge view!”
Reviews.Author: nelgster
Reviews.Content: Spent the night Saturday and our room had an amazing view! The staff was very professional and friendly and made our stay one we will never forget. Great location in the financial district on Embarcadero near Farmers Market and AT&T Park as well as a short walk to Union Square. Jason with Harbor Court Hotel hooked us up and made our trip fantastic. We will definitely be back and will recommend them to all our friends! It's cool that they're pet friendly. Great place, nice people, you can't go wrong at Harbor Court.

Reviews.Title: “Exceed your expectactions at the Harbor Court”
Reviews.Author: Raindogkelley
Reviews.Content: If you have ever stayed at a Kimpton property you already know they are very hip and relaxing with a wine hour every day and comfortable lounge area with a fireplace and overstuffed chairs. The Harbor Court exceeded our expectactions with the location and the hospitality. I was a little hestitant in staying here because we are not pet people. But we did enjoy other people's pets. My wife is a little allergic around animals but the rooms are incredibly clean and my wife had no problems at all. The rooms are very small - it is a boutique hotel remodeled from the YMCA! However the bed was very comfortable. We stayed on the seventh floor and it was very quiet. No street noise and no next door noise or slamming doors. The location is very close to the Ferry Building and the Embarcadero BART. Public transportation is very accessible to other parts of the city within a couple blocks. If you are looking for a convenient romantic get away, I would recommend the Harbor Court.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating Staff & Clean Room But Needs Some Updating”
Reviews.Author: Ruebrezin
Reviews.Content: We had the unfortunate experience of staying on the 4th floor (requested a lower floor). We didn't know that right below us is the YMCA that is next door and below us. So we had loud noises from the weights and punching bags (as the staff explained). We went up to the 5th floor to check the noise and it was still bad. Finally got a room on the 8th floor which was quiet enough. The hallways and elevators still feel like you are in the old YMCA residence. The elevators are kind of slow and rickety. Eeek. Beautiful view from our room towards the Bay Bridge. Accommodating staff is really best part of this hotel but likely will never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat trip- still impressed”
Reviews.Author: RS82547
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two years ago for a wedding and came back to combine a visit to the wonderful city of SF. Remains a great place to stay. The location is excellent with the Ferry building across the street with its shops, restaurants, and the farmer's market. It is convenient to other restaurants and the financial district with its shops, etc. Staff is fantastic. Jason, the manager is there nightly with the wine reception and the overall helpfulness of the staff is top notch. We wouldn't stay anywhere else when we come to SF.

Reviews.Title: “CHECK YOUR BILLS FOR EXTRA CHARGES !!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bluejinty
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Harbor Court with friends. Nice decoration and staff were nelpful whilst we stayed there. When i checked into my next hotel and checked my card balance I found the hotel had taken $200-00 dollars more than i was invoiced for. On the phone they said it was usual practice. It was incase they found any charges needed to be added. They then said it would not be returned to my account for 7 x days. At no time was this charge explained to me or was it on the check out bill. Very dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinoy99
Reviews.Content: nice bay location excellent room view of the bay/bridge walking distance to embarcadero shopping & ferry short distance to Giants Stadium & Fishermans Warf - walk/jog/train/street car nightly wine reception / cookies & milk / daily morning coffe free 10-15 body massage on some nights for singles/couples only due to room/bedding size excellent japanese sushi place adjacent to hotel

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: bettyUK
Reviews.Content: WE stayed here for 3 nights and found the location excellent. We had a good rate for a three night stay and had a bay view king bed room. The room is on the small size but larger than I'd feared given the previous reviews. We had enough space for all our bags. The down side is only having one chair . The views were great and the location on the embarcadero and near the Ferry Building was spot on. It was lovely to wander out in the early morning with a coffee and stare across the bay and watch the joggers. It's not a great location if you're into shopping but we are not, although we enjoyed wandering through the Ferry Building stalls and eateries. The hotel has tea/coffee in the morning, wine in the early evening and milk later on - all in the lobby. This is a very pleasant seating area with comfy chairs, fire, TV and a couple of computers (Ithink there were two). If we ever make it back to SF, we'd certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: sperry17
Reviews.Content: Kimpton has become one of my go to hotels while traveling. Mainly because I have a friend that works for them so I'm able to get the friend rate, but also because I love their modern decor, pet friendliness and complimentary wine tasting. This Kimpton is just as good as the others I've stayed in. Wonderful service, very clean and in a great location if you want to be close to the piers. We decided not to upgrade to the bigger room or the view since we were only going to be staying for one night but for the extra $20 I think it was to have the bay view and a slightly bigger room I think it would have been worth it. Our room was very clean and nice, but by far the tiniest Kimpton room I've ever stayed in. So take it for what it's worth we didn't spend too much time in the room so that's why we went smaller but if I went back I'd upgrade and definitely if we stay more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny...”
Reviews.Author: J_M_S_Toronto
Reviews.Content: When we decided to vacation in San Francisco from 10/9 to 10/14, we wanted accomodations that met two important criteria: 1) great location 2) a high quality, boutique hotel reflective of the city and its surroundings. The Harbor Court Hotel delivered on both counts, and more. We opted to pay extra for a view of the harbour, and it was worth every penny. Stunning views of the Bay Bridge, the bay, the Embacadero, gorgeous sunrises, even the air show and fireworks events for Fleet Week, which occurred during our visit. The room itself was small, but not cramped and it was perfectly suitable for two people. It was immaculately clean. The Aveda toiletries were a much-appreciated extra touch. The bed was so comfortable, probably one of the most comfortable beds I have slept on! The sheets and duvet were pristine and the bed was beautifully made up every day. We enjoyed the morning coffee bar, and evening wine reception (we didn't try the nightly milk and cookies). The manager of the Harbor Court Hotel is very personable and helpful towards his guests, as was the entire staff we encountered during our stay. The location of the Harbor Court Hotel is fantastic. It is away from the touristy Fishermans Wharf area, but we were able to walk just about anywhere in the downtown area of San Francisco. It is expensive to park in the downtown area. We rented a car and it cost $40 for one night of valet parking at the Harbor Court Hotel- but from what we could tell, that seemed to be the going rate in the downtown area. Overall, we loved staying at the Harbor Court Hotel and would recommend it to anyone looking for a high quality, unique, boutique hotel in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Belle at the Bridge..”
Reviews.Author: Juju37-10
Reviews.Content: My wife and l stayed for 4 nights in Sept., beautiful building with a large , chic lobby. Staff were friendly enough and the room was perfectly adequate and spotless. View over the Bay Bridge really nice and, due to jetlag, caught a stunning sunrise over the bridge. Location is perfect for transport, Ferry Building etc and felt quite safe at nite, overall l would not hesitate to recommend the Harbor Court. Finally, a big thankyou to manager Jason Stone who left a nice surprise in our room to help celebrate our wedding anniversary...

Reviews.Title: “Mother/Daughter Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Kim2848
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we were in San Francisco for Fleet Week and the Italian Heritage Festival. I take my daughter to the Columbus Day festivities because that is her birthday weekend. We choose Harbor Court Hotel for the location and the pictures online looked really nice. And it was exactly like the pictures. The location was spectacular. The hotel had a wonderful coffee bar each morning (free), a wine reception each evening in their beautiful lobby/living room (free), and milk and warm cookies each night(also, free.) There was water service and cookies at the front desk all the time. We loved the hotel staff and the manager. He told us of the history of the building and the hotel. We left our luggage there after we checked out to tour more of San Francisco. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cassandraburke
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights just to get away from the norm for a little. The location was wonderful, nice and close to good food and good shops. The only plan that we had was a Giants game on Sunday night, and walking there was a breeze! The staff was nice, answered all of our questions about getting around the city and things like that. As others said the room was really small, but since we didn't spend that much time in the room and packed light, it worked for us. I could see how it easily could be too small for a lot of people though. All in all it was a good deal for the price that we paid and the convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “harbor court”
Reviews.Author: djmartinGosportUk
Reviews.Content: stayed at the harbor court september 24th-27th very nice hotel friendly staff hi to the little dog would stay again thanks

Reviews.Title: “quiet but small room and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: marcovanbatty
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and would recommend....only quibble was the price....very expensive for the size of the room...which was very small. No breakfast but coffee and tea in lobby. Excellent service at all times from the staff. decent location as close to union sq and the embarcado and some very good restaurants within 15 mins walk.... very quiet so got a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A Primo Stay on the San Franciso Bay”
Reviews.Author: Karina777
Reviews.Content: The Harbor Court is tucked away on a quiet street of beautifully restored historic buildings between the chic, rambling plazas of the Embaradero and the shores of the San Francisco Bay. The staff, from the bellman at the door to the cleaning staff in the halls, are alert, friendly, and helpful. The rooms are bright and clean - yes, on the small side - but modern and cozy with comfortable beds, natural bath products, and select California wines in the mini-bar. You need not break that seal, though, as there is a wine reception each evening in the lobby (featuring free massage), and fresh-baked cookies every night. The Ferry Building across the street is filled with cafes, boutiques, and fresh produce, while local artists and growers sprawl into the sidewalks outside three days each week. Muni stops, ferry docs, shopping, a movie theater, and the YMCA are steps away. If you're thinking about staying in the noisy, crowded blocks around Union Square, think again. This is a great hotel in one of the most beautiful and accessible sections of the City. (Book a room by the bay: let the gulls sing you to sleep).

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to get excited about”
Reviews.Author: sobrien.uk
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at the Harbor Court on September 1 - 4. Our experience got off to a somewhat rocky start at reception. First, the person checking us in gives us this look like we are something that he found on the bottom of his shoe. Then the fun begins because apparently our reservation was for 4 days previous and we were a "no show." After confirming our mistake and apologizing to him greatly he let us squirm awhile before he said that although the room we booked was no longer available and the rates were higher, he could allow us to stay in a smaller room at the same rate. As we were exhausted we agreed and given instead of the deluxe queen with harborside view, a regular queen without view, Room 611 is probably what it once was - a former YMCA room of about 10 x 12 albeit with the few requisite upgrades. Not bad but definitely too small for 2 people to be comfortable in. Luckily, in our entire stay we had no more contact with any of the staff who I observed being rather snooty with guests. On a positive note, the location was nice and we enjoyed staying in a new part of the city. The Ferry Building was a nice spot to have lunch or dinner and Perry's, the perennial SF favorite, has a restaurant in the adjoining hotel, the Griffon, where I will stay when I return next month. All and all not sure why this is rated so highly, nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “You might as well just stay at the YMCA”
Reviews.Author: Ukiahdds
Reviews.Content: For a mercifully short two days in September 2010 my wife and I stayed at the Harbor Court Hotel in San Francisco. Our arrival was inauspicious. I was immediately told that I should have parked in one of the 3 places reserved for check-in, even though their was a bus parked in all 3 of them at that time. Our check in then went smoothly enough, but when we arrived at our room we were surprised to see that is was barely big enough to contain the queen sized bed. The first floor of this hotel is a small reception area and a large lobby, then floors 2 and 3 appear to be occupied by the YMCA which was at this sight for many years. Kimpton has apparently tried to convince people that by paying $250 and up a night they should be happy to stay in rooms once occupied by transients passing through town. The location is great, near the Ferry Building and with lovely views of the Bay Bridge if you are willing to pay more for this option. The hotel was clean and quiet, but with the room charge, valet fee and taxes, we payed nearly $700 dollars for 2 days, which is outrageous given the size of the bedroom and accompanying tiny bathroom. If we shall ever again see the words "Kimpton" or "boutique" attached for a hotel, we shall run quickly in the other direction.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: Davidedetta
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, the room was very clean and quite big. ( do not understand the bad comments on the room size!) the staff is ok, even if they re not very friendly (they pass the day on their computer without saying good morning or good evening) In any case, we recommend this hotel when staying in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “It's All About Service”
Reviews.Author: 2muchstuff
Reviews.Content: Any hotel can boast a boutique feel, waterfront location, cozy beds and charming furnishings, but a truly spectacular property is once at which the hotel staff is always wondering what they can do to make a guest's stay more special. Harbor Court Hotel's General Manager Jason Stone sets the tone at this waterfront, boutique hotel with his outstanding commitment to customer service. Mr. Stone is truly invested in the well-being of his guests, and he has trained his staff to those same high standards of service. The wine reception and milk and cookies before bed are terrific, but it's the standard of service behind them that makes Harbor Court stand out as a wonderful property. Thanks to the entire staff for an amazing 40th birthday weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Best Weekend Ever”
Reviews.Author: jskell
Reviews.Content: I just had the best weekend ever at the Harbor Court. It wasn't huge but the room had everything we needed. We went with the room with the view and loved it. Who knew the bridge could look so good? (I'll post a pic if I can get it off my phone). We slept with the windows and blinds open all night. I even caught a glimpse of the sunrise. We will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: AlanPeters
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at Harbor Court, and could not have made a better choice. Recent reviews on TA indicated the Embarcadero area overlooking the Bay Bridge was an ideal location, both for scenic views and getting around, and we found both to be true. We walked a block to the Ferry Bldg. for the Sausalito Ferry and trip to Muir Woods, both sites truly memorable. The California St. Cable was only a short walk also, with no wait, and an easy trip up to Nob Hill and drinks at the Top of the Mark. The rooms are not large, but are very well appointed and we had a king view room with a perfect view of the Bay and the Bay Bridge, beautiful both day and night. Beds are very comfortable, with fine linens and good towels for the bath. The staff is top notch, especially the Gen Mgr., Jason, who hosted the complimentary wine reception each evening during the week. He was a source of great information about what to see and do and where to eat and drink; a most personable host. All other staff members were equally friendly and willing to help. We loved having Perry's restaurant next door, as the prices were quite good and the comfort food suited our tastes. We did not try Ozumo, as we are not sushi fans, but the bar was hopping during the week. All in all a terrific place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: JMH79
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a nice quiet part of town. It was located close to the street car stop so it was still easy to get around though. Rooms were very clean and modern but on the small side...only room for a bed. Staff was friendly and the wine reception each evening was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet boutique hotel in the Embarcadero”
Reviews.Author: RiversideRR
Reviews.Content: Nice location a block from the Ferry building. Near the financial district, so it's quiet in the evening. Nice room with comfortable queen bed. Well appointed good sized bathroom. Friendly staff and a big lobby that's pretty nice. Saw a couple playing some Wii bowling there.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: frangipani1960
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the harbour court Aug 7th to 10th had a wonderful time we has a queen view room the view was lovely of the bay bridge, some rooms had a view of the ymca i'd def pay the extra for a view room a little small but was fine didn't have a safe in the room which was unusual but we used the fridge as you had to lock it. The staff were wonderful Tina & john on front desk francisco on concierge was very helpful. and Darcy Davis was wonderful had a great chat with her at wine evening all made us welcome, the wine evening sat by the fire chatting to fellow travellers was great, to coffee in the mornings cookies at 9pm and lemomade in the afternoon all a great touch. Free wi fi for kimpton members.web check in all done for us. The hotel is in good location for everthing great thai restaurant asha was amazing and reasonable.Also the fog diner was good. All in all yes great hotel thank you all

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with beautiful view of the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: JoLa_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbor Court whilst in San Francisco and couldn't reccomend it highly enough. Good location near the waterfront and a beautiful view (worth paying extra for the rooms with a view), very peaceful, nicely furnished rooms - very elegant, just a lovely place to relax in at the end of a long day's / evening's sightseeing. The staff were excellent too - I had a medical scare and had to visit the emergency room while there - staff put me in touch with a doctor, booked a car to take me to the hospital (on the hotel) and also assured me I woudn't occur further parking charges (I was due to check out that day) to leave my car in their garage. Really great to have that level of service in a rather distressing situation. Gets a big thumbs up from me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value but forgo the view and ask for a quiet room with bath”
Reviews.Author: theproo
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms in this hotel, one for me and one for my Mother. My room had a crap view of the side wall of the building opposite but it was quiet and had a bath. My Mother's had an OK view had no bath and was very noisy from the air con units on the adjacent building below and foot traffic from the elevators close by. The beds and pillows are super comfy and the rooms are surprisingly chic for the price of this hotel, as are the Aveda products supplied. The rate I got didn't include breakfast but there is the "farmers" market across the road with decent coffee and bakery stands. Location is good for shopping downtown and catching a cable car. My only minor complaint is the hot water to make tea was not hot enough. It would have also been nice is if you could swivel the TV around so you can watch it whilst in the bath! I would definitely stay here again. Tip: join the Kimpton frequent stay program if you want to take advantage of free wifi. Otherwise you'll have to pay $10/day.

Reviews.Title: “Modern feel; great view”
Reviews.Author: Jenrainey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the Embarcadero. It is about a 20 minute walk to Fisherman's wharf, Union Station or China town. The upper rooms have a great view of the bay bridge. The rooms are very small, but functional; furnishings are modern; high speed internet is available for no cost by joining their loyality program. The hotel is dog friendly & the staff is exteremely friendly & efficient. The lobby of the hotel has a fireplace and several comfortable seating areas where one can relax while enjoying a glass of complimentary wine in the evening. In addition to wine, there is lemonade & Iced Tea in the afternoons & cookies in the evening. All very nice touches. Parking is expensive at the hotel ($40 with unlimited in/out); we opted to park at a garage accross the street in an office building. It was slightly less on week days, but only $10/night on weekends (no in/out priviledges). For the money, this is an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and a fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leicester_Girl
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights at the Harbor Court Hotel. The service will leave a lasting memory with us as nothing was too much trouble and the hotel staff helped us find a cheap laundry nearby, suggested where to hire bikes from, advised on bars for eveing drinks etc and booked numerous taxis for us. The room we had was quite small but the staff on reception moved us from our 2nd night into a much larger room which we preferred. The room was relaly modern and apart from a safe, had everything that we needed including free Aveda products. The internet is also free and super fast. The free coffee/tea, wine and cookies if a lovely touch and is all included in the price. The staff also let you keep your bikes, if you have them overnight, for free in the storeroom to avoid them being taken from outside.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of the city”
Reviews.Author: Karennadog
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in San Francisco and use to gravitate to the St. Francis. In the last few years I try to stay at the Kimpton chain due to their philosophy, Eco-friendliness and their commitment to providing a home like space for people and their pets. At the Harbor Court, their warmth and genuine kindness can not be put into words. Their can do attitude extended to my every request. The views are exquisite and every member of the staff provides the most genuine commitment to treating you as they would want to be treated. I will never stay in any other hotel in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: RioVistaMomma
Reviews.Content: We paid extra for the view of the bay - it was lovely. The room and bed were comfortable - the room is small, but adequate to move about in. Found out it is pet friendly and that they have a reception in the "living room" in the evening with wine. The "living room" has comfortable seating and a fireplace - very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - what a fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: vulcancruisers
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending nearly a month on my 50th birthday motorcycle tour of the western states. Our stay at the Harbor Court will certainly go down as one of the highlights of our vacation. I cannot praise this hotel highly enough. We loved it so much that we added an extra night to our stay just so that we could continue to enjoy the experience (staff kindly gave us the same discounted rate as we had obtained online). From the moment we arrived we were greeted by highly professional, welcoming staff and we just loved the place. The room was excellently appointed, and clean to my wife's exacting standards and the quality of service was just amazing. The finer touches such as complimentary lemonade and ice tea in the afternnon, wine tasting each evening in the very comfortable lobby lounge with hotel executives (thanks for choosing to personally meet us and ask about our stay Jason) and milk and cookies before bedtime just added to the experience. Our thanks to all of the staff and congratulations to General Manager Jason Stone for his personal attention that clearly makes such a difference. We look forward to visiting again. L and C from Vancouver, BC, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Kimpton style, but location not perfect for me”
Reviews.Author: redheada1
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in the Union Square area and this time decided to be closer to the Ferry Building, so I chose the Harbor Court. It is wonderfully close to the Ferry Building, but it was a long walk to the other areas I enjoy in SF. There are not a lot of amenities really close by -- yes, I consider "roughing it" to be having to walk a block and a half to a Walgreen's. I had a king bay view room and the view was lovely, but the windows were rather small. I was disappointed there was no safe in the room. The small bathroom did not accommodate a vanity and had only a small shelf for toiletries. Because the hotel was out of the way from the other things I was doing, I didn't get to enjoy the wine reception, afternoon iced tea, or evening cookies. If you don't mind the location or the room size, the hotel is great. Exceptionally clean, great amenities, friendly and helpful staff. Kimptons are by far my favorite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: PhilMurray
Reviews.Content: Location beside the ferry building was great. Just a quick tram ride on the gorgeous old trams round to Fisherman's whary and the Alcatraz ferry. Staff friendly and helpful. Lots of extras provided at the hotel - wine evenings, lemonade in afternoon and cookies and milk late evening. Room good - clean, well provisioned. Shower and small bath. Joining kimpton in touch gives you free in room internet access which was great. Slightly disappointed to have no in room safe. I do expect this to be provided in a hotel of this quality. Was able to use a safety deposit box at front desk - thats ok but still second best. I paid extra for a room with a bay view. Its good but not worth the extra money. The room did not make the view a main feature - two smallish windows at either side. So - OK but not worth the cash.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, quiet room, near the Bay Bridge and the wharf”
Reviews.Author: BedandBreakfastFan56
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night at Harbor Court Hotel but plan to return. Our room was cozy and clean and so very quiet! I asked for a quiet room and got one looking onto a rooftop, and it was so quiet, I slept like a baby! The bed was so comfortable and bedding so soft, both my husband and I were impressed. We enjoyed being within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf and the Cable cars. On Saturday morning there was a huge farmer's market on pier across from the hotel, we took our hotel to-go coffee and snacked on the samples for breakfast. We enjoyed seeing the dogs of other hotel patrons in the lobby. The staff was so helpful and friendly. There were delicious cookies in the lobby in the evening, and coffee and tea in the morning. The hotel was beautiful as well. We loved our Harbor Court experience and hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Location Plus View”
Reviews.Author: Howard_LA
Reviews.Content: This is well located for walking to AT&T Park and our room had an outstanding view of the Bay Bridge, the bay and the Embarcadero. Service was very good from the manager to the front desk to the maid. The room was rather plain, but the lobby is an alternative spot to relax (and drink free sangria in the late afternoon). All in all, very satisfactory and we would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: demarcate
Reviews.Content: This is my second time here - love it. The location on the water is awesome, close to subway access and cabs and restaurants. The Ferry Building food market is across the street. Love that when I come down in the morning there's good coffee, in the afternoon lemonade & iced tea, in the evening wine, and at night fresh baked cookies. Rooms are awesome - clean & stylish, super comfy beds. Best of all it's my favorite thing - a very cool upscale hotel without any pretense. Only thing - don't use the YMCA that's attached, it's kinda um... not good.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views of the Bay”
Reviews.Author: Cloudshadows
Reviews.Content: Absolutely one of the most memorable trips I had involved this hotel. It was also a much higher price than I usually spend on a hotel, but it was to celebrate my husband's 30th Birthday. The extra money on the view of the bay was worth it, amazing day and night. It was a great location to the Ferry building, AT&T park, walking to coit tower and more. Staff was very nice, and provided us with wine from the evening reception we missed. Our dog loved the place as well and one of the main reasons I chose this place is because they didn't charge extra for our small dog. We chose to park in the garage near Yerba Buena gardens ($32 for 24 hours) I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel with all the nice touches”
Reviews.Author: gcmilburn
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at a Klimpton hotel, but I was very impressed from the first time I walked into the lobby. My wife and I stayed one week for a vacation in San Francisco. The staff was very helpful in directing me to public transportation (only a short walking distance to train, bus, or light rail). The lobby was vibrant with wine tasting, cookies/milk each night, and even a Wii game console for guest to play some nights. While the room could be a bit larger, it was nicely appointed with a great view of the Bay. I would recommend paying for a Bay View Room. My only negative is the lack of a fitness center and the $10/day charge, but the YMCA adjacent to the hotel offers everything you wouild want in a fitness center. Overall, a fine choice from Kimpton.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel With A Terrific View”
Reviews.Author: JDincalif
Reviews.Content: What a great find! We had a "getaway weekend" in San Francisco over the Memorial Day weekend and as we particularly like Kimpton Hotels we didn't think we could go too far wrong by booking a stay at the Harbor Court. We were not disappointed. We booked a standard room with a queen bed and discovered that we were upgraded to a queen view room overlooking the Embarcadero and the bay and the San Francisco/Oakland Bay Bridge. As soon as we entered our room we were spellbound by the view. After spending an evening out attending a jazz concert we returned to our room and were met with the scene of the waters of the bay glistening by the twinkling lights of the Bay Bridge. We stood in our room and gazed at this portrait with the room lights turned off. This experience alone was priceless - as they say in the credit card ad. Our service from the staff was exceptional as we have come to expect from this hotel group. The room was adequately but not overly furnished with hardwood flooring rather than carpeting. Our bed was positioned so that we could look out of the windows to see the view. There was only one desk chair in the room and a couple of more comfortable chairs would have added to the enjoyment as an added comfortable place to scenery gaze or to watch T.V. rather than standing at the window or sitting on the bed. But that criticism is but trivial to the total experience we enjoyed at this property. Oh yes, there is free wine hour near the lobby in the late afternoon and don't forget the milk and cookies waiting in the lobby when returning from a late night's entertainment. The hotel is only about a block away from the downtown financial district and the Ferry Building. For baseball fans the Harbor Court is only a fifteen minute walk down the waterfront to the Giant's ballpark. We will certainly stay here again and we will be more than willing to reserve a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “A Pet-Centric Hotel Where You Don't have to Sacrifice Quality or Service”
Reviews.Author: sb_jonathan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many hotels over the years while traveling for leisure with our pet (dog) family members. While many hotels provide li service that "pets are welcome" we have never felt more at home and comfortable with our dogs than during our recent stay at the Harbor Court! The on-staff canine working the front desk eagerly welcomed our dogs, while the rest of reception personnel made us feel welcome, even special. The facility is gorgeous, from lobby to individual rooms, and is impeccably maintained. For the guest traveling without a pet, you would never know there are dogs staying at the hotel. With or without pets in tow, the Harbor Court is our first choice for lodging in San Francisco. Great location, friendly staff, wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “what a lucky exchange”
Reviews.Author: squorls
Reviews.Content: As our travel plans had been forced to change due to the flight delays from the UK. We had wondered what to expect upon our arrival. Frist impressions was excellant and so was the reception. We was shown a selection iof rooms and chose to upgrade to a 'Bay view room', that was our best move wakng up in the morning and looking at the view of both bay and the bay bridge. Though out our weeks stay the staff in all departments could not do enough for us, with any questions or enquires we may of had about getting around and places to eat, and locations to visit Although this hotel is located on the edge of the financial district the location proved to be excellent for getting around and was very close to the buses, cable cars and only 5/10 minute tram ride from pier 39. I can say without any doubt that when we retiurn to San Fransisco in a few years I would have no hesitation about rebooking at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: trippin76
Reviews.Content: I love Kimpton Hotels, they have the best beds ever, and Harbor Court lived up to my expectations. The boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights and really enjoyed ourselves. We had a basic king room. It was small, but what reasonably priced room in San Francisco isn't? They did have mirrors on the wall so at least it looked bigger and you didn't feel like you were in a tiny place. The room was clean and I love the Aveda products in the bathroom. My only complaint (and it's not even really a complaint) about the room was the view - or lack thereof. Our window looked out onto the wall of the building next door. I swear it was 2 feet away! But whatever, we weren't there for the view - we went outside and saw everything! On one of the evenings we enjoyed their free milk and cookies and sat by the fireplace in the lobby. It was very homey and relaxing. A nice bonus. The location is great too. Right by the Ferry Building that has an amazing Farmer's Market. If you're there on a day they have it - check it out. We were able to walk to busses and the Bart easily as they are only a few blocks away. Next time I'm in SF I would consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “My new home when I travel to San Francisco - awesome service”
Reviews.Author: elena6434
Reviews.Content: This hotel has got that special atmosphere that makes everyone in it work together to make sure you feel special. I can't single out one act of graciousness, becuase there were so many. Warm fresh chocolate chip cookies and milk in the lobby as an evening snack. Quick location of a driver fora last-minute need. A glass of wine to relax in the gorgeous lobby. All little concerns or questions welcomed and addressed with care. Genuine friendliness. The front staff even stepped outside to enjoy the gorgeous full moon over the bay bridge you could see just out the lobby doors. So, I highly recommend to those who enjoy things that are authentic, unique and customized.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SF_Fan_10
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a great location. We stayed here on the weekend. It is just down the street from the Ferry building which has a fantastic Farmer's Market on Saturday morning. The desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Andrew the manager went out of his way to make our stay very enjoyable. The hotel is very pet friendly. They provided treats, food and water bowls and waste disposal bags. Just up the street is a very nice grassy area for your pet's needs. The rooms were on the smallish side but we had enough room to put our dog's crate under the desk. The room was very quite. I am a light sleeper but had no trouble getting or staying asleep. There are complimentary drinks at night and coffee and tea in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: finestfur
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a nice quiet room on the 6th floor with a view of the Bay Bridge. The decor was lovely, with two windows, dark wood furniture & comfy chair by the window. It was clean & well maintained. There is a turndown service in the evening, although for me the only benefit of this is the free chocolate left on your pillow! The weather was terrible when I arrived, but the room heating worked well. I'm not a fan of oriental food so didn't try the attached restaurant or room service. The Rincon Centre across the road from the hotel entrance has a good selection of places for quick bites (e.g. coffee, subs, ice cream, breakfast, pizza) + there is a market on the corner with a deli, soup bar etc Free wifi is available for Kimpton In Touch members (free to join on the internet) Personal preference of mine would be to have in room coffee making facilities, however coffee/tea etc are available each morning in reception & the wine reception each evening Would definitely stay here again as it's ideally placed for public transport, the embarcadero & shopping without being in a noisy or touristy location

Reviews.Title: “Totally well-cared for”
Reviews.Author: SCZ64
Reviews.Content: From the minute I checked in (three hours early, no problem), till the minute I checked out (when the front desk staffperson volunteered that since I was unexpectedly leaving early to catch the redeye, he would give me a half day's rate), I was treated beautifully throughout. I went to the Kimpton-iconic happy hour the two evenings I was there: one night, I just wanted to grab a glass and go back to my room to work, and that was no problem; the second night, I had time to chat, and I had a wonderful conversation with the manager. I also had a great experience with the front desk helping me secure transportation to a part of the Bay Area where taxis prefer not to go. And the setting was perfect: super easy access to the Embarcadero, including SF's wonderful farmers' market, with a fantastic view of the Bay and the Bridge. The hotel itself was lovely and attractively decorated. But the staff is what really made the place. Bottom-line, it's just the kind of hotel where they are sensitive to a traveler's moods and needs, and great about meeting them. I travel a lot and have stayed in at least 10 hotels in SF--but from now on, I'll be staying at the Harbor Court when I'm in SF. My one smallish gripe relates to the gym: there is easy access to a great Y, right next door, but I think $10 for a workout is excessive (although I recognize that's fairly standard for hotels using external gyms). And for the record, although I probably stay in hotels 50 nights per year, this is the first time I"ve ever written a review.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location! Steps away from the ferry building...”
Reviews.Author: Akelleral
Reviews.Content: We stay at a lot of Kimpton hotels and this so far is my favorite. The folks working at the reception desk were incredibly friendly and upgraded us to a room with a view. Let me tell you about this view...we literally were looking across at the water with the most picture perfect view of the bay bridge. The ferry building is a 2 min walk and steps away from amazing restaurants, farmers market, and shops. The hotel offers the usual Kimpton wine reception and morning coffee. They also were offering an afternoon tea/hot chocolate and cookie reception. The only downside to this hotel is the high priced valet service. That is one thing I really wish Kimpton would change. I know other boutique hotel lines in the bay area are about $10-20 cheaper...so it is possible. I have enjoyed all of my stays at Kimpton hotels, but the Harbor Court Hotel was something special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: msteacher1
Reviews.Content: Well-located right along the Embarcadero (an especially good choice for joggers!) Good restuaratns nearby and the ferry to Sausalito is right across the street. Great value for the price. Rooms are not huge, but had everything we needed. Helpful staff and very comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “lower your expectations for this Kimpton hotel”
Reviews.Author: dnpinva
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with this hotel, and it is a pleasant enough stay. For the price, however, and for a Kimpton hotel, I was disappointed. The rooms are quite small. The decorations are kitschy.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel experience in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: OCgirlSoCal
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Harbor Court Hotel for business and leisure and each time it has been a fantastic experience. The location is great for my business, surrounded by wonderful restaurants, a nice walk to the wharf and BART is only a few blocks away. The evening happy hours are enjoyable as well as the coffee in the morning. I recommend this boutique hotel - especially the rooms with an ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay on the Bay”
Reviews.Author: Karina777
Reviews.Content: This is a great spot to be in the heart of the city and on the water at the same time for an affordable price. The hotel is contemporary and immaculate, with a colorful lobby where you can sit with friends for daily wine tastings, find a cozy chair in the corner, or use one of two IMACS availalbe to guests. The staff is friendly and attentive without a hint of the arrogance that can creep into a front desk crew. Ozumo, one of the best Japanese eateries in the city, sits on one side of the hotel, a slick YMCA on the other - both with deals and special services for hotel guests. The Ferry Building and farmers markets are right across the street. If you can affort a bayview it's well worth it. After staying at 4 and 5 star hotels in the city for the past 20 years this was my favorite. I'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “This place is ideal for the traveler who craves price and luxury on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: Thouston299
Reviews.Content: I live in a quaint, lovely town on Los Gatos, CA.
